reviews.text: There are times when I&#39;m  in the mood for CF. When I&#39;m at Dadeland, 9/10 times, I choose Cheesecake Factory. One of the things I like the most about this place is the extensive menu. The ambiance is cool and easy going. The waiters, especially the ones at the bar side, are friendly and courteous. On one of our visits, I complimented the warm brown bread in the basket. Our waiter was so cool that when we left, he gave us a full loaf of the brown bread. It was a random act of kindness and so unexpected. But those are the kind  things that bring you back to a place.  I enjoy their  appetizers like the avocado egg rolls, nachos, and lettuce wraps. They have a pretty flavorful light menu that satisfies pretty much every appetite. I don&#39;t have much of a sweet tooth but the variety of cheesecakes are sure tempting too. <br><br>My only complaint with this restaurant is overall cleanliness especially in the bathrooms. They need to have a  better system in place to ensure all is stocked and kept clean. Every time I stop in, the garbage receptacle by the door is overflowing, some toilets are out of paper or some other area is not too clean. I really like CF but I would love it even more if that was addressed. Believe it or not, everyone notices bathrooms and when they are comfortable and clean it keeps everyone coming  back. As a matter of fact, I bet if this one thing gets better and the wait times are improved, the overall ratings will go up? Maybe?

Haven&#39;t been to one in some time so me and a few friends decided to go there. We arrived at 10:30 which is an hour before closing time. This is the only reason that comes to mind of why we had such a bad experience (I usually go to the dolphin mall branch and will most likely go only there after this). I ordered the carne asada stk medallion. Of course before that we got the bread pretty late and it was squeezed so much where you cut it with the knife it almost became a flat bread. Also a little burnt. When asked for white bread the waiter said that&#39;s the only bread he has. Talking about the waiter. Can&#39;t say he was completely rude, but he gave us that uneasy sort of feeling. Maybe he had a bad day maybe not, but it added to the annoying service and food. <br><br>Going back to the meal. The steak was pretty good, on the other hand the fries was cold and stale as if it was taken from the leftovers of another guests plate. This was exactly the same case for my friends fries in his order of fried chicken sandwich. <br>I told the waiter, he offered no apology and just said do you want rice instead. I said no. Yet another unpleasant part of us coming here. <br><br>Like I said I&#39;ll definitely only go to the dolphin mall branch, at least it&#39;s closer.

I love it here. I have to say the waits can be very long but the food is always on point. They have tons of selections from steak to pasta to salads. Today I had the <br>TOMATO BASIL PASTA<br>Grilled Chicken, Fresh Mozzarella, a Touch of Garlic and Penne Pasta. Light and Fresh.<br>And my husband had the <br>SHRIMP AND CHICKEN GUMBO<br>Shrimp, Chicken, Andouille Sausage, Tomatoes, Peppers, Onions and Garlic Simmered in a Spicy Cajun Style Broth with Cream. Topped with Steamed White Rice.<br>Both delicious. Service is always great and you cant go wrong weather is a family meal or a date even.

Last time I&#39;ll eat at the Cheesecake Factory at Dadeland mall  in Miami. Cold food and the worse service I have ever experienced. I dine at the Cheesecake Factory almost weekly, not at this location. I have tried here multiple times, it&#39;s dirty, silverware is dirty, floors are dirty, bathroom is dirty. If this was an Cheesecake Factory example, I would avoid the restaurant entirely, the other location I have been dining in, Boca Raton and other cities are excellent.<br>Clean up, get training, this is not the way.<br>I had to call the manager to help too many times today, cold food, food not as I ordered, super long wait, no refills on water and dirty stuff from utensils to the table. <br>Manager did apologized and brought a Cheese Cake, thank you for trying to making it right and talking so good, but this location needs a lot more help. It needs to be cleaned up.
It was great. The service: she our waitress was fantastic and she organized to sing happy birthday to my son on her own.<br>Thank you.

This is honestly one if ny favorite restaurants. Their menu is huge, like soooo many options that im always taking long time to decide. My favorite are the pastas. Ive tried different ones snd they&#39;re always so good. Great dessert menu. Great drinks, specially their cocktail ones. Appetizer? I usually go with their fried mac and cheese, fried calamari, or the new avocado egg rolls. <br><br>I gave them a four, because the wait there is horrible. I guess its because it&#39;s in a very central location. Other than that, waiters/waitress are nice.
Highly recommended. Food was great and excellemt service . Had vegan burger and it was very delicious

Honestly giving a 5 star because Steve the manager was extremely kind and understanding. I was having an allergic reaction and he was so helpful and respectful. Service was not to great but he made up for the experience.
Amazing Restaurant, I love every dishes,,,<br>Lovely waitresses<br>The most amazing old fashion drinks ever

With the amount of options the Cheesecake Factory menu offered, you&#39;ll definitely find something for you. <br><br>From burgers, to pastas, and everything in between, you should be solid! <br><br>Of course they offer a massive menu of cheesecakes to choose from. Personally I have tried the cinnabon cheesecake and that one is insanely good if you like that cinnamon flavor flavour and texture.<br><br>This time around I had the lasagna verde which was a lasagna made with spinach pasta instead of regular pasta and it was surprisingly actually really good. I got it topped off with shrimp and you cant really go wrong with it.<br><br>The person I was with got the spicey chicken sandwich and that was also a good choice if you want something like that. By the way, when they ask which sauce you want, you can ask for all of them on the side if you aren&#39;t sure. (Chipotle, buffalo, ketchup, etc).<br><br>Today Jorge was our server and he was just great. He honestly made my dining experience feel like I was at a spa. He really just has this way of being intense, but calming at the same time. It&#39;s really obscure but I actually liked it haha.

Came by during busy brunch hours. Only waited 20 minutes and service was excellent by Anibal!<br><br>I had the flat bread and salad lunch serving and it filled me up! I am taking half the flat bread to go.<br><br>Anibal our server came by multiple times to check on us and refilled our drinks every time on time.<br><br>Enjoy your next visit to cheesecake experience.

Cheesecake Factory in Dadeland Mall has reopened!<br><br>I had the Thai Lettuce Wraps which I have been dreaming about for months.  Tasted better than I remembered <br><br>Social distancing and staff all up to code.  <br><br>You can now make a reservation and even make special requests such as being seated in the outside patio.

We placed an online order for a whole cheesecake, and asked -and payed- extra for something write on top of the cake that wasn&#39;t there. When we went to pick up the cake they make us wait like 45 minutes and they were really rude because somehow they couldn&#39;t found our order.. terrible customer service. What a terrible experience.

Great experience ! I did the reservation through the website, which is user friendly and easy to manage. We arrived I think it was almost 5 minutes late and the host was very pleasant and attentive. We had a great time, food was amazing.

Picked this up 2 times last week and the food tasted just as good as it is when dining in! I ordered the appetizer pretzels with the cheese dip and it is now my favorite appetizer ever!!!! For my meal I had the skinnylicious lettuce tacos which are so flavorful and filling! I aways order the sweet potato fries, they are my weakness!

We came specifically for the grilled salmon and three of us happily ordered the dish. About 20 minutes later our waiter comes back to inform us there is no salmon tonight! We were so disappointed. Our frazzled server did not have much to say about it, gave us some menus and did not come back for quite a while. At that point, everything on the menu was not anything I wanted. I settled for a burger, but just kept dreaming of the salmon.

This Cheesecake Factory location is A-OK.  I was in a couple of weekends ago and ate at the bar.  I received excellent service from the bar staff.  I ordered a burger with fries and a beer.  The burger was decent but came with not warm fries.  On my burger was a giant onion slice that made it impossible to hold the burger in my large hand.  Overall, I had a good bar experience and an average food experience.  There was lots of seating but still a wait on a Sunday afternoon.  I am glad I was a single diner and ate at the bar.  I would go back here for the usual extensive Cheesecake Factory menu.  I would temper my expectations for an average experience.  This location is very convenient in Dadeland.  3 stars ...

I used to love this place and look forward to it every time.. maybe I built it up in my head but this time around just wasn&#39;t the same. We ordered a flat<br>Bread with a salad did lunch. The flat bread was more<br>Like a thick Chicago pizza and the salad was drenched in dressing..

Margaritas are served in not typical margaritas cup and about 75% of its content is ice. Not worth the almost $12 price tag.<br><br>As many restaurants are doing, their tips suggestions for start at 18%. Of course you can put whatever you want but I think the gastronomy industry is moving to the wrong tips numbers.

Cheesecake Factory is my go to spot! I love the pumpernickel bread and the pastas. The menu is so large that there is literally something for everyone. You cannot go wrong at Cheesecake Factory. The Cheesecake Factory Cab Savg 9 ounce pour is usually what I pair with any pasta I order. I love the regular traditional cheesecake with the strawberry. Pulling back 1 star because the last two times I&#39;ve been there I have had two separate issues, one being that my wine glass smelt like bleach, they happy replaced it with a new one, and secondly, my tomato pasta dish was overpowered by garlic (like tons of garlic) that I was burping it up for 3 days ... I love garlic but it was too much. In any event, I will definitely always be returning to cheesecake!

I always order my birthday cake from here because the Hershey Chocolate Bar Cheesecake is BOMB! If you&#39;re a chocolate lover, GET THIS! It has chocolate chips on the edge of the cake that really gives you the texture needed with all the mousse and silky layers! Totally recommend! They are linked with DoorDash which I thought was nice but I got a little annoyed when checking out. So DoorDash automatically shows you promo codes that they have available BUT when I went to type in the promo code that worked with my order it said that &#34;the promo code was not available.&#34; I then tried out all the promo codes and they all had the same result. It was a little annoying that I could have saved $15 but for some reason the coupons weren&#39;t working when they should have been. <br><br>ANYWAYYYYYY<br><br>Moral of the story is that Cheesecake Factory is still bomb and DoorDash needs to get their act together!

Always a good lunch or dinner at this location. My family and I have always enjoy our meals and never really had a problem with our orders. <br><br>The location is very clean and always busy. The wait times are never to bad for walk ins. One of my all time favorite dishes is definitely the &#34;chicken Bellagio&#34;. It&#39;s by far the tastiest dish that have. The battered chicken with the delicious pesto sauce and the fresh prosciutto is a great combination that always hits the spot. Super hardy dish. <br><br>The cheese cake factory at dadeland mall is excellent. I go there often and will continue to Do so in the future.

We came by not to break the tradition to get a dessert but decided to do the late lunch thing! Had to wait about 20 minutes but I didn&#39;t think it was bad for The 26 of December! <br><br>We got to the table and ordered! Or server Africa Marisol... uh,  don&#39;t ask. She was great . She suggested a couple of items and they were on point! We ordered the Chicken Bellagio, Thai Lettuce Wraps and Buffalo Blasts. Delicious! <br><br>We asked to see the Chef to thank him personally. It is rarely that patrons thank the Chef! I am going to make it s point to thank the chefs to the restaurants we visit! Cudos to Chef Josh!!

The waiter Alexis D. from Cheesecake Factory in Dadeland Mall was exceptionally rude stating &#34;you said fish and chips but if you want fish tacos you can order it.&#34; I said ok then he proceeded to say &#34;if you would&#39;ve said fish tacos from the beginning I would&#39;ve asked if you wanted it grilled or fried.&#34; Even though I said it loud and clear that I wanted fish tacos, that even the people next to me heard it. I was very disappointed in the customer service that was provided.

A classic. <br>Who does not love this place? I am still looking for that person.<br>Ok it is not the healthiest but they also have a skinnilicious menu for the pickiest among you... <br>Everything is so tasty there I can&#39;t just pick a favorite but everytime I go I NEED to get the mac &amp; cheese, the stuffed mushrooms and to finish with a sweet: the amazing Red Velvet. The salads are very good too. <br>The prices are good and the service as well!

Never a dull moment at cheesecake, whenever we are in Dadeland Mall this is our to go to restaurant .. yes everything is like super fatting but soooo good , this time we ordered the texmex roll , dynamite shrimp, shepherds pie , crispy chicken tenders and the brunch chilaquiles everything was sooo good soo much food except the chilaquiles they we not so that good but everything else soo yummy and the best part we ordered the mango lime cheesecake omg this is to die for...

We ordered for curbside take out tonight  easy to order on line and to pick up  they were organized and a friendly person brought the food to the car, mask and gloves of course! <br>Food was a good portion and was tasty   thanks guys!

I had the avocado egg rolls; they are deliiiicious!!! Our server Melanie was amazing she came several times to check on us and had a friendly smile always. Waa very accommodating and knew the menu thoroughly. I had a not so good experience last time and Im very glad that I decided to give it another chance. A friend had the salmon and he loved it and another the thai coconut lime curry chicken and she loved it to

I love eating at the cheesecake ever so often, however this time I noticed a few different changes made to the menu. They discontinued some of the salad which were really good. The service took forever and I had to keep asking the waiter to come back because he would forget what we had asked him for previously. It&#39;s a shame because the prices go up while the quality and variety is definitely going down

Order to go and they accidentally made a mistake on the order. I called and the manager Carolina was very friendly and immediately offered for us to go the next day to pick up the order again. She personally gave us our order. Great customer service!

Never disappoints! Always great service, great eats, easy parking and short waits for seating. Bar seating is always available if the wait is too long and we can&#39;t forget the cheesecake! Top notch! In addition this spot has allergy menus too if needed! Worthy of a repeat visit!

The desserts in this place are amazing but you already knew that. I went there and had the chicken salad sandwich and it was delicious and our waitress was also really good. Thumbs up to Felicia for the great service she provided. The Carrot cake for dessert was also amazing, I would go back anytime...

The Cheesecake Factory has a beyond extensive menu so there is definitely something for everyone, I attempt to try something new each time.  Always a great way to start with their famous &#34;BROWN BREAD&#34;, served nice &amp; warm!  I shared the SWEET CORN TAMALE CAKES and I had the BREAKFAST TACOS, both very good dishes &amp; full of flavor.  For dessert I took home a piece of the MANGO KEY LIME CHEESECAKE, as good as it sounds!  I like the bar area of this restaurant, a good amount of high-top tables for small groups with first come, first serve seating.  Located inside the Dadeland Mall close to plenty of parking and valet services.

Curbside order...  ordered from here today at 7:20pm and was notified that my order would be ready for pick up curbside at 7:50. It&#39;s 8:21 and finally get a text saying it&#39;s ready after calling multiple times and getting told that &#34;it&#39;s almost ready&#34; or &#34;it&#39;s raining.&#34;  Sitting in a car and waiting over an hour with a hungry 4 year old screaming &#34;I&#39;m hungry&#34; is not an acceptable business practice I would condone. When the food was received at 8:45, fries were soggy, steaks, burgers, and vegetables were cold. When you spend $100 you would expect to get food that is at least warm.  Extremely disappointed.  Just a terrible experience all around.

Menu is overwhelming. Portions are not too generous but a bit too expensive.  The cheesecakes are great too but the one I had didn&#39;t feel like it was fresh.  Prices are high. Staff was ok. I also tried sheppard pie, it was so oily, was swimming in an oil.It was an average experience all around.

Honestly, the make the best cheesecakes. With a hugely varied selection of entrees, salads, soup, chicken, seafood, pasta, and steak dishes alongside endless sandwich and appetizer items-its impossible to not find something you like. The entrees here are always served in a supersized portion that&#39;s perfect for sharing or taking home. It&#39;s always consistent when it comes to service, food quality, and selection. Their strawberry martini is by far my favorite drink here as they are made to order with fresh muddled strawberries. I&#39;ve tried almost every flavor of their cheesecakes and have yet to be disappointed. You can always count on Cheesecake Factory for an exemplary dining experience. When I don&#39;t have space for dessert, I take a slice home to enjoy later.

While the hibachi steak was delicious, I got an order of sauteed vegetables instead of the tempura asparagus that I was looking forward to. Make sure you order pick instead of delivery so that you can check your order.

Food is good, but you knew that.  They&#39;re full all the time, so they seem not to care about the service anymore.  Empty bottles sat on the table through dessert.  &#34;Water please.&#34;  No water.  &#34;Butter please.&#34;  No butter.  &#34;Box please.&#34;  No box.  And why fix it when the line&#39;s our the door?  Unfortunate.

It&#39;s always a mission. With the entire COVID situation you&#39;d think ordering out was simple. My order said it would be ready 30 mins after ordering which was no problem. Then when I get there to arrive, 30 more minutes waiting. When I called the restaurant, they were rude and didn&#39;t even ask what car I was waiting in. Food is ice cold. Trash. I work so hard for +$100 to get trashy tasting food.
Great service as always and I mean honestly anything and everything on the menu is good!

Ordered an Oreo cheesecake slice to go online and it was super easy to pick up. You just have to pull up outside give them a call and someone comes to give it to in your car. The cheesecake of course was delicious like always

The food and the service was horrible. I was there with my wife and my two small children. Supposedly, their is no longer a kids menu, food took forever to get there over 25 mins and I ordered everything as soon I sat down to not have a delay. To top it off when my dish got there it was raw , orange chicken . No comp at all.. Never again .Don&#39;t bother ! Grab a cheesecake to go from the counter and keep it moving .
The food here is okay.  Prices are little too high. They seemed to keep on increasing their prices through the years

Cheesecake factory is always a good idea when you do not know what you are in the mood for, as they have a million and one things to choose from. <br><br>I have had so many things here and I don&#39;t think I have had a complaint yet. Their fried mac and cheese is absolutely amazing, their Asian lettuce warps are mouth salivating good, four cheese pasta is yummy and their cuban sandwich is just delicious. Unfortunately, if you&#39;re on a diet..... I would not recommend you coming as you&#39;ll be missing out on many delicious items. However there is a skinnylicious menu. <br><br>I have been coming to this location for so long, I cant even remember when I first came! But do know I will continue to come back over and over again.

The server took for ever to great the table. After ordering drinks and soup, it took her a good 18min to bring the drinks, bread was never brought to the table nor was our soups. She stated she didn&#39;t bring them cause they were salty. After ordering food, still no bread,  I asked her for some bread, drink refill and blue cheese.  Food arrived after 20min, still no bread or drink refill. The food presentation was horrible, my daughter and I ordered the same food and the plates looked totally different. Got up, went to the bar for my drink refill,  the bartender sent another server with them. After finishing eating,  still no bread and no refill from the server, she came to take the empty plates. I asked for the bread and 2 deserts, I really wanted the bread with blue cheese. Another 15 min passed, finally the deserts arrived. For the billed,  that she took right after the deserts. But after another 20min she never picked up the bill, another waitress came with the bill and well. <br>Horrible service, for once the food was good but poor presentation.

We came for Easter Sunday and even though it was packed we only waited about 30 mins for a table of 6. I have to say the food has gotten better. I ordered Renee&#39;s special which is a chicken salad sandwich and my husband had the fish tacos. We were impressed. The service was on point, our waitress was friendly and came a few times to check up on us. I believe towards the end she was swamped with tables because we waited a long time for our bill but other than that we had a great experience

I ordered the salmon today along with mashed potatoes and brocoli. However, the salmon  was uncooked and the broccoli was cold and hard!!!! Additionally, at the beginning we received the house bread and the white bread was hard like a rock. Definitely ruined my experience today... I have been here a couple of times but today was the worst visit!!!

Solid chain food . I always get the sweet corn tamale cakes. ... chicken and biscuits for dinner ... Rene&#39;s special ... and for cheesecakes I get the mango cheesecake and the pineapple upside down cheesecake

This is our staple girls lunch spot. I am not a big &#34;chain&#34; girl but this lovely spot has made me a loyal fan. Thanks to them I come here! I consider this place every time I go out looking for a nice spot to take a friend. The menu is endless and accommodates any diet you are in (reason #111 why I always  suggest this spot!).

Having been to several Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over the US it seemed like a smart choice late on a Tuesday evening when the kids were starving and no one wanted any one thing in particular. <br><br>We were seated fairly quickly for a group of five but that&#39;s about the last positive experience we had here.<br><br>Once seated, no one came by for over 20 minutes. We actually had to find someone. Then, the waiter did not write down our order and asked us to repeat it, twice. Drinks took another 10-15 minutes. When the food finally came, we were missing one of the kids meals. Then it came out missing it&#39;s side. The check took a long time as well, though giving my credit card over was quick.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is, usually, very busy I know but this was post 9pm on Tuesday so that was not the case. It was just all around poor service with no apologies. The two stars are because the food tasted like it does at every other Cheesecake Factory and that is something.

Cheesecake in my opinion is one of the better chain restaurants out there. The portion sizes are huge and very filling appropriate for the prices of the plates. My new favorite dish is the Almond crusted salmon salad- it was everything I could hope for in a salad! Other faves of the night included the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake and the Oreo cheesecake, although I&#39;m sure every single kind of cheesecake is to die for! Love coming here every once in a while!

Been coming to this location for years...today, after covid 19 regulations started I called to see how long the patio wait time was before heading over, I was told 10 minutes. I arrived, we were a party of 5 (2 adults, 1 teen and 2 toddlers) I basically put those numbers as a party of 4, being 2 adults, 1 teen and 2 kids as half an adult. Upon arrival I was told they were only taking parties of 4. Common sense would be to A, advertise it over the phone just like they say open for patio dine in only or B, when you call advise as you speak to someone over the phone. So dissapointed, management is ridiculous.

I understand that we&#39;re in a pandemic, but 30 whole minutes waiting for two slices of cheesecake is ridiculous. I don&#39;t know what the &#34;strategy&#34; for efficiency and safety is. But the time spent waiting for cheesecake is not worth the reward. I will not return until everything was as before

I visited this restaurant several times years ago but, the decline in food quality I only came back for drinks. Thursday night I visited with a friend from out of town and we had appetizers with drinks. I got sick.. <br><br>Within hours I was violently ill and the next morning he was ill. My guest travelled to Miami to see me and we spent our time together vomiting and laying in bed with stomach pains. <br><br>We had two drinks each with avocado egg rolls and another similar appetizer dish.<br><br>I&#39;m still beyond livid.
Always on point when it comes to customer service and really good food! The eggs benedict was amazing on top of the chicken and waffles.
Service was really slow and inattentive. Then u found these &#34;clean&#34; utensils in my napkin, waiting for me to use.

I have a love/ hate thing with this restaurant. <br><br>I think things have drastically changed with this chain over the years and has gotten to big to keep consistency. One of the main problems is they make way to many items to keep up with quality and consistency. The menu is like a mini novel. You can literally spend 20-30 mins looking through it and wonder what page to reference of the other thing you thought about getting. That being said, it&#39;s nice when you go with a group that wants a wide range of types of foods.<br><br>As for the food, there are thing I really enjoy. I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve ever had anything bad, just lack of overall consistency. My favorite, which is not on the menu anymore is the Portobello on a bun. They will actually make it most of the time if you ask. <br><br>It&#39;s kind of a sin to go here and not have Cheesecake... I have noticed the size of the slices have gotten smaller (back to my consistency argument). One a good note the taste has remained the same. <br><br>The staff is always friendly, but they seam to be running around a lot. Long waits unless you sit by the bar. That area is first come first serve.

What can I say , I love to eat at Cheesecake Factory , I&#39;ve been at all of them in south Florida. From Naples to westpalm beach to coral gables , coconut grove to the tinny one in coral gables . I must say yes you may find some issues . But the selection of food is mind blowing great tasting food . From handmade salads , to their chicken little plater, or meatloaf plater, or Parmesan crusted chicken , steak, or seafood . To many Items to mention, and over 30 cheese cakes to choose from , by friendly knowledgeable staff , pretty clean restaurant,it&#39;s worthwhile the long wait sometimes . Large portions at a reasonable price you may have to  take home food .
I came here in 10/2/20 and I had a good experience you should come here for you birthday the dolphin mall at night it&#39;s stunning I would recommend

My family and I had dinner last night at the Cheesecake in Dadeland mall. I didn&#39;t notice the waitress never return my credit card only after When I tried using my card to make a purchase the next day. I called the restaurant to explain of my missing card and I was put on hold and was never attended to. There was several fraudulent charges to my account especially at a place called Little Hollie which is very close by Dadeland mall. I guess the waitress that served us took it for a ride. <br>This matter will be investigated. I&#39;m sure is not the first time this happens. Be careful when paying <br>with your credit card. Make sure you get your credit card returned. You can be scammed by your server.  <br>The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t even deserve one star.<br>A couple of months ago they served a raw piece chicken to my son. They manager Raul was very apologetic but my son couldn&#39;t gotten sick because of the meat not being cooked properly. <br>We tried giving them another chance and we get scammed. I don&#39;t think this restaurant is safe or even health to eat.

Four Cheese Penne Pasta with Chicken was delicious. Fettuccini Alfredo with Chicken was excellent but had too much sauce. Despite this place being utterly full, Olivia was an outstanding waitress - taking care of getting our food on time and always greeting us with a smile.<br><br>5 Stars for sure!

Terrible experience  we went yesterday thinking let&#39;s go to a place we know food and service are going to be good , well what a disappointment! Service couldn&#39;t be worse and the food was terrible , it took forever to got our food everyone around us people who came after us left and we were still there, no one approached to apologize until I&#39;ll my husband asked the server. The manager no where to be seen after we call her because food was bad she showed up not even offer to refresh drinks and it looked like she can&#39;t make decisions because she needs to asked other manager , to make long story short she change the meal for another more expensive took off the ones we originally order and charge for the new ones but the worse thing is she never returned to our table to followed up or to apologize we were bothering her  !<br>One star because can&#39;t gave zero .very disappointed love cheesecake not this one

I am a huge fan of Cheesecake Factory. I frequent them often all over the USA. This particular location, Dadeland, has been my home base one for many years now. I feel like I can always count on a decent meal- it&#39;s standard. I like to switch my meal up every now and then between some small plates or chicken avocado club sandwich. I noticed today at lunch that the service was just not good. The lack of response, checking in, etc from the server was very minimal. There were several times where my drink was empty and needed a refill and he was nowhere to be found.

I just had a fabulous dinner with my lovely wife and daughter at Cheesecake Factory dadeland. We were bless with an amazing server named Stephanie. If you ever come to the Cheesecake Factory I suggest asking for Stephanie.

This review has nothing to do about the quality of the food or how it tastes. The food here is always phenomenal and incredibly yummy! It&#39;s the service that I, time and time again, have an issue with. Every time I come into this restaurant (no matter the day of the week or the time I come in) the wait is ALWAYS 45 minutes plus. Now, Don&#39;t get me wrong, I usually don&#39;t mind the wait! BUT, when 45 minutes becomes an hour and 45 minutes I lose a bit (a lot) of my patience. I know what you&#39;re thinking, that this could have been a one time occurrence. But then, I came in a Sunday afternoon at 3:00 pm, was told it would be 30 minutes and waited TWO HOURS just to be seated and waited another 45 minutes to even see a waitress of have water. <br>I will never recommend this place. I&#39;d rather drive an hour north to the Las Olas location than to sit through the terrible service that they provide here.
Had a date here.. nice environment great customer service.. food deliciousness super satisfied.. coming back again..

I really like the Cheesecake Factory, but this location is always SO BUSY! This time, I happened to come on national cheesecake day, when cheesecakes are half off, and the wait was ridiculous. I was told that it would be 40 min, and that I would have to wait within 10ft of the restaurant for the buzzer to work. The women&#39;s bathroom stalls were completely out of toilet paper and really messy. However, I still waited, and other than that it was good.<br><br>I ordered the chicken bellagio (my go-to) and a slice of cheesecake. The portions are huge and I had enough leftovers for two additional lunches.  I also got to try the celebration cheesecake, which was fun. It has chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry mouse and some birthday cake. Doesn&#39;t top the red velvet, but still yummy!

Seated quickly. Ordered chicken and shrimp gumbo which was tasty. However the bread given before the meal was hard. Addressed the issue with my server and received fresh hot bread within minutes so no complaints there. Out Server was very present. I tastes my husband&#39;s Pasta Napoletana it was exquisite and I will definitely order that next time. Overall, the food was great and keeps me coming. However the cleanliness of the place could use some attention as the tables and flatware had to  be wiped down before I could start eating. For dessert I had banana cheesecake one of my favs.

The portions are sooo large. The menus are very extensive and hard to choose from with the amount of options they provide. The food is very tasty. I&#39;ve tried many dishes of which are all good. The dessert is the best part. Our server today was great the last time not so much. Now can we just talk about how dirty their bathrooms are. They are always dirty paper everywhere. I&#39;ve been to this location like 4 or 5 times and it never fails, bathrooms are always nasty.

Although Cheesecake Factory has good food, the service is not so great.<br><br>From the moment we sat down, we felt rushed.  We ordered my daughters food first and some apps.  After receiving our apps and 45 min passing, my daughter STILL didn&#39;t receive her food.  I was told by the waiter is would be out shortly and shortly became 20 extra mins.  The manager came to our table to apologize but didn&#39;t comp the meal.  <br><br>The waiter kept telling us to speak to the manager so that I can get it comp&#39;d and I believe he should of done it without me having to ask.  <br><br>Honestly, very unprofessional staff and place is dirty.  <br><br>The only reason why i am not giving this a 1 star review is because I love the food.  Aside from that, everything else needs work.

If I could rate lower I would went in on Saturday to eat outside with my husband and 3 kids my kids are little and they wanted to seat 4 People on one table and 1 person across on the other side. I kept explaining to hostess I have 3 small kids and I cannot separate my family like that I ask if my small 2 year old could sit between my husband and I or if the stroller could be next to my seat Manager didn&#39;t want to resolve and hostess had an attitude the whole time and kept saying the wait is 2 hours the wait is 2 hours with a nasty attitude ,pick better employees if you want customers. worst service I&#39;ve ever experienced

WOW! I love this place! Every time I come here with friends or family. We are never disappointed. The food here is to die for and let&#39;s not even talk about the cheesecake (you&#39;ll die again!). I usually come for lunch and have the monstrous chicken cali club sandwich. But this time I wanted to try something a little bit different. I ordered the coconut chicken and shrimp on a bed of rice with pineapple and other veggies. This was very tasty, it was featured on the &#34;specials menu&#34;. My son had the kids spaghetti and meatball, and my girlfriend had the hibachi steak.<br><br>Later for dessert we ordered the birthday cake cheesecake and the chris cheesecake!! Wow. <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to come back here again! <br><br>Would like to give a special thank you to our waitress for being so attentive and helpful in our decision making.

Ordered online and put utensils in my cart- didn&#39;t get them . Now I&#39;m in my hotel room eating my food with my hands.  Hotel literally 2 miles away and food was cold, not just a little cold , cold cold.  If you were going to be open, get your act together for takeout orders.

The wait here is ridiculous considering the place is not full of patrons. This particular Cheesecake Factory is located in the mall. I usually love the Cheesecake Factory food especially the steak Diana however, today the food was horrible. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this particular location to anyone.

My husband loves this place so sometimes we come here for dinner. I find that the restaurant has a lot of items and would be a great option for large groups because everybody can find something that they like in the menu. The place offers salads, appetizers, pastas, burgers, sandwiches, large plates, brunch, and any type of cheesecake concoction you can think of.<br><br>I usually order the Americanah burger which has lettuce, tomato, bacon, crispy potato fries, and pink sauce. The burger comes with fries or with a salad. It&#39;s usually very good and I love it. It&#39;s huge so every time I eat it I feel very full. Sometimes we order the Vietnamese summer rolls which is a very Americanized version of this traditional dish but enjoyable enough. <br><br>Overall, the place is a good option for a large group, prices are reasonable and the menu is very varied.

Disappointing!<br>Celebrated my nephews birthday as he chose the restaurant for our family dining. Everything was good, service was good, appetizers were good. Drinks were good. The menu is extensive so I just prayed that what I ordered was tasty. Well, I messed up as I ordered the pasta napoletana and since the menu doesn&#39;t specify  that the dish may be spicy.  I had my first bite I tasted something spicy. I tried a few more bites and it just got hotter and hotter. I called our server to tell her that unfortunately, I was not able to eat what I ordered because of the heat. She said yes it is the sausage. She immediately offered to replace my order for something else.  <br>I wasn&#39;t impressed with the food itself. My second dish was pasta with meatballs and it was bland. Not the greatest.<br>After telling our server that it was a bday dinner, they brought my nephew and big piece of cheesecake and sang him the birthday song. He was a happy camper.

Horrible pretty much sums it up. <br>After 1 hour and 15 minutes after being sat at our table we left hungry as hell since we never received our food. Oh yeah we did receive the appetizer, nachos. After being auctioned off to 2 other tables I waived the server.... So no chicken as ordered on the nachos and instead of sour cream a huge scoop of mayo... Yes Mayonnaise on our nachos ... YUCK!!! So it&#39;s now been 50 minutes we finally ordered (a manager had to come and take our order after our server left me speaking to myself as she literally ran off and left me mid sentence when another angry customer came to her to complain about waiting 30 minutes for her bill) and my daughter finally received her lemonade.. yes 50 minutes for a lemonade. At an hour and 10 minutes still no food. After a nasty attitude by the server Giselle/Gigi which included rolling of the eyes and sucking her teeth at me we had it. We got up and left, we ended up picking up a pizza. Thanks for the amazing night out Cheesecake factory... This one is one for the books.

We&#39;ve been coming to this Cheesecake factory for well over two decades.  Aside from it always being packed, it&#39;s been consistent for good food, HUGE portions, and decent service. It&#39;s one of the few restaurants that can get away with being a chain , offering a ridiculously huge menu AND still delivering good food. Just about everything you order is tasty, with few exceptions. The cheesecake, of course, is almost always delicious, and super dense and filling. Leftovers for the next day are common when we visit Cheesecake factory.<br>Some tips to reduce your time spending in the crazy waits :<br>- Avoid going during peak times- lunch and dinner hours on weekends. When going during the weekend, try to plan it for late morning or mid- afternoon. <br>- Grab a table top in the bar area, which requires no reservation<br>- Ask for first available seating, which includes the exterior seating area<br>- Take it curbside, order online or by phone and pick up your food on the side<br><br>Some of our favorites:<br>1. Miso Salmon with brown rice<br>2. Orange Chicken with brown rice<br>3. White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake <br>4. Fresh Banana Creme Cheesecake<br>5. Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>6. Chicken Madeira <br>7. Pumpkin Cheesecake<br>8. Blackout Cake<br>9. The free breads (both sourdough and wheat are great)! <br><br>They now also offer a Skinnylicious menu, for those who are calorie conscious. I&#39;ve never tried it ! :)

Ive ordered delivery from them many times but today when i ordered i was very disappointed because they completely forgot my cheesecake so that sucked. Besides that the spicy chicken chipotle pasta i always get tasted so different to previous times. I was kinda upset because its so good but today it was not.

For me Cheesecake Factory is one of my to go places for good comfort food during any type of occasion. Even though Cheesecake factory has expanded to other locations the quality of the food its not what it used to be, but regardless we are still loyal fans. We decided to have an early dinner last Monday, and went to the location in Dadeland Mall, and we were lucky to be seated right away. Depending on the day there can be long wait times, so plan accordingly. <br><br>Once you are seated they bring you complementary wheat and sourdough baguettes, which are amazing especially when they are bring it out nice and warm. I also take my time looking at the menu which looks like a mini bible, but don&#39;t get overwhelmed just pick different plates to share. This time we decided to order an old time favorite pot stickers and something new the avocado toast, and then the main entree we choose the Ahi Tuna with brown rice. <br><br>The Pot Stickers are pork dumpling steamed and then fried to give the brown crispy bottom, and then they soak it with a delicious soy vinegar. The avocado toast is a baguette toasted and then cut in half with a amazing spread of mashed avocado with red onions, olive oil,  tomatoes, and basil leaves. It was a delicious appetizer and healthier then other options. Then the main entree arrived and it did not disappoint, the tuna was rare as I requested and very fresh, they used a miso based sauce that went excellent with the brown rice. Come and try it and you will understand why it one of my favorite.

The Cheesecake Factory never fails me...overall good food and service. I like the fact it has a variety of food choices even a skinnylicious menu for the people who are watching their calorie intake. Another observation is that even though it&#39;s always full of people waiting to be seated it never takes longer than 30min at least when I&#39;ve gone. What I still need to check out is their brunch specials Saturday&#39;s and Sunday&#39;s which I hear are pretty good. When I do decide to come for their brunch I&#39;ll update my review.

The cheesecake factory is one of our favorite go to restaurants and typically have a good experience; we generally sit at the bar area.  Our server (forgot her name ) was really nice and always checking on us. <br><br>I ordered the Chicken Marsala. As you know, it is a chicken breast sautéed with fresh mushrooms in a &#34;rich marsala wine sauce&#34; served over bow-tie pasta.  <br><br>The problem with this dish was the chicken breast and the pasta were a little overcooked and lacked a true &#34;rich&#34; wine taste.  I was not only hungry but disappointed at this hefty $20 meal.  The presentation was the only good thing but I don&#39;t think I can recommend this dish. <br><br>The other &#34;dish&#34; were the Buffalo Blast. This appetizer are good size portion of chicken, cheese and their spicy buffalo sauce then stuffed in a spiced wrapper and fried until crisp. It&#39;s also served with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing; my date was happy with this as her meal.

I&#39;ve been here many times and I usually have the same meal. I am a creature of habit but this time I veered off the beaten path to try something new.<br>I tried the chicken parm &#34;pizza&#34; with Alfredo pasta. Service was slow and it took way to long to get our food. But once they brought our dinner I was excited. We all eat with our eyes first and this dish was a lovely sight that my eyes quite enjoyed. It was a round breaded chicken breast crust, fried to perfection. Topped off with tomato sauce, mozzarella and a small portion of Alfredo pasta right smack the saucey middle. <br>All I needed to do was taste it. As I took the first bite I felt the satisfaction of the crispy crunch of the chicken only to be disappointed by the complete absence of salt or any seasonings for that matter. I trudged on but sadly the dish fell flat in the flavor dept. I&#39;m sorry to say that as much as I really wanted to like this the sad truth is that it was completely devoid of flavor. Despite the lack of seasoning I ate a little over a fourth of it the way a dad would eat a meal his 15 yo daughter prepared for him even though she completely forgot the salt. Uhhmmm that may or may not be a real case scenario, I&#39;ll plead the fifth on that one. <br><br>So just to recap; usually love CCF and will definitely be back...just not for the chicken parm pizza.

I usually never have a problem with my service here but today was absolutely awful.<br><br>I arrived at 9:15 for a late dinner with a colleague. Upon arrival I asked to be seated outside and the hostess said it wasn&#39;t possible. At the moment it just seemed like she wanted to go home for the night and was a bit irritated. We settled for a table inside and were seated immediately. Our server took a while to acknowledge us. Once he noticed us, he took our drink orders. <br>About 10 minutes later he arrives with our waters and bread. <br><br>We didn&#39;t know what we wanted to eat just yet so we spent some time looking over the menu. <br>Henry(our serve, who never introduced himself) came back and asked us if we were ready and I ordered an appetizer. <br>I ordered the Brussel sprouts ! (Which I&#39;m a huge fan of)<br>The brussel sprouts arrive nearly 30 minutes later and are cold me did not come how they are usually served.<br>I let Henry know that the food was cold and his response to me was &#34;do you want me to warm it up?&#34; He ended up taking them back and removing from my order but it was all just terrible NO HENRY I DONT WANT YOU TO WARM MY FROZEN BRUSSEL SPROUTS. <br><br>I&#39;ll probably get high and go back for a slice of cheesecake eventually.... but it will definitely be for takeout.

Food was literally swimming in a pool of oil.  I feel like I was punkd and the food I ordered came from a different restaurant.<br><br>This was a delivery order.  I&#39;ve had a good experience in the past ordering a similar dish (the chicken Costoletta).  Everything was very well packaged. And Brown Bread, ketchup and butter were included.  This is the reason for 1star.<br><br>This time I ordered the Parmesan-Herb Crusted Chicken. Menu description said: Sautéed chicken breasts coated with Parmesan-Garlic breadcrumbs, served with Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans.<br><br>The &#34;breadcrumbs&#34; were a flavorless, gummy, oily paste that was stuck to the chicken like a piece of rubber.  This looked like it was cooked 3 days ago, and was reheated and packaged for me.  Chicken was tough like leather. <br><br>Mashed potatoes didn&#39;t have a grain of salt.<br><br>Green beans were just thrown raw onto the plate.<br> And to top it all off, a cup of oil was poured over everything. I placed the edge of a napkin and in a matter of seconds it was drenched in oil.<br><br>Disgusting, expensive food that I could not eat.  Oh, and the bread was stale.

I ordered a filet mignon steak with grilled shrimp and asparagus. The steak was fatty, hard, and basically inedible. In addition, the shrimp was considerably cold. It took them approximately 45 minutes to make another filet, and it came out the same way as the first. Avoid Cheesecake Factory (at least the one in Dadeland) unless you want overcooked, overpriced food
What the hell happened to this place?  <br>It&#39;s so dirty and tasteless now.  <br><br>Go eat literally anywhere else around Dadeland instead.

I went for brunch this past weekend and the food was amazing. <br>Please note that they dont take reservations on the weekends, as noted on their website. However, they do take them during the first hour of being open. Also, half of your party must be present in order to be seated. <br><br>I had the jambalaya hash and eggs. It was delicious and had the right amount of spice. It was one of the best brunch dishes I&#39;ve had. I also had the egg roll sampler. It was decent for the amount and the sauces were bomb! I wish they listed what the sauces were. <br><br>The tropical tiki punch has a nice flavor. They were generous with the alcohol which I was pleased about. <br><br>Please note: On Sundays, they do not serve alcohol before 12 due to them being near a church. <br><br>The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because we had to wait a long time for our checks to be split. Apparently the drinks and food were rang on separate tickets and it was a hassle merging them and then separating them. Other than that, everything else was great. We were seated quickly and the food came out quickly. <br><br>Shout out to John, you were awesome!

The hostess at this Cheesecake location was extremely rude and unprofessional. When we arrived to this location, we were greeted by 3 hostess and were asked how many in our party. When I mentioned that we were 8 we were disregarded. The main hostess indicated that she had to get a manager. We literally had over 20 parties put themselves on the waiting list and the manager never appeared. We have a toddler that is 2 and was extremely hungry. Unfortunately, because of their poor attention we ended up leaving.

Great experience at this location, came on Saturday night. Even though it was extremely busy our waiter, Mike was so attentive right on point. He came to the rescue with extra bread when he noticed my child having a meltdown because he was hungry. <br> The kiddos both had a grill salmon with a side of French fry washes it all down strawberry lemonade.<br> I had the avocado rolls, it&#39;s an appetizer but I wasn&#39;t that hungry. There are nice, warm, filling and guilt-free<br>We all shared the ultimate red velvet cheesecake for dessert sooooo gooodd!!!!<br>They have an amazing Saturday &amp; Sunday brunch menu from 10am-2pm.

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory multiple times especially to this specific location in Dadeland mall. We came in late afternoon and it was packed which was expected of this location despite the business, we were seated rather quickly. After sitting down and ordering it took a while for the food to finally come out at least 45-50 minutes at the minimum. We were a party of 3. We ordered the carne asada Plate which was my plate, parmesan herb chicken plate, and two appetizers the mushrooms and the calamari. My food came out last and I ordered it medium well, but it was medium rare I had to send it back once it came back, I could be wrong, but it appeared to have food missing because the portion for a 20 dollar plate looked way off I had 4 tiny pieces of meat surrounded by a heaping amount of rice and mashed potatoes. I must say the mashed potatoes were delicious, but I was not happy with the plate.  I wouldn&#39;t order it again. Finally, we ordered the chocolate marshmallow s&#39;mores galore, now that was amazing. I&#39;ve always liked the Cheesecake Factory, but I left this time a bit unhappy

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory ??? Definitely I am one of those that LOVE coming here . Ever single time I want to order something new but I always end up ordering the da Vinci pasta ! So I decided that I would order a new appetizer instead . This time I had the loaded potatoes tots!! What a delicious bite . They come with spicy mayo and sour cream on the side for dipping . The portion is good for sharing with somebody and still have space for your entree.  The da Vinci pasta was on point, like always ! Super creamy , great portion and al dente just how I like it . This place never disappoints, I love coming here from time to time and specially with friends after work or a casual date night with your hubby. Hope you enjoy my pictures!
AMAZING FOOD!!!! Awesome service, literally the best sandwich i&#39;ve ever had in my life omg. highly recommend!!!

Horrible dining experience at this Cheesecake Factory I was christmas shopping with my family in dadeland mall, and we decided to eat out at the very fancy looking cheesecake factory, so when you see fancy you expect the most important thing to be fancy, which is the food.<br>I got the whole complete opposite of it, i came in with 5 family members and only 3 of us were able to eat. I ordered the lasagna from their menu which took forever to get to my table, everybody else got their food and i waesnt able to eat with my loved ones, not only was i not able to eat with my loved ones but when I received the lasagna it was only tomato sauce and cheese! No pasta, no layers of anything, just tomato sauce and cheese!, instead of lasagna it looked like a tomato sauce soup! Did not eat it... my partner ordered the chicken pasta, and received it with only one little piece of chicken and a whole bunch of pasta, she then called the person who was helping us and sent it back, when they brought her pasta back with more chicken, they also brought it back with hair on top, which caused us return the pasta and not order anything else from their menu, horrible customer service at the front, definately the worst cheesecake factory ive been to located at the dadeland mall.

Restaurant was not too busy. We got seated right away. We waited over 30 minutes for bread. We only got one small basket for our party of 6. My food was bland, my husband mashed potatoes were cold. My daughter French fries were definitely not what we are used to. Our waitress was not friendly at all. She called our daughter a boy... Each staff that brought our plates (except one) slammed the dishes on the table. I don&#39;t usually write reviews but this one was bad... let&#39;s not even talk about the men restrooms with pee everywhere on the floor... never got a refill of bread or water as a matter of fact! We love the Cheesecake Factory brand but this location is definitely lacking!

I come here from time to time just cause it&#39;s a classic place for a night out. However, this time, I had a different experience from my previous experiences.<br><br>I came here with my family and for some reason we had two waiters but I didn&#39;t mind. We ordered our food and proceeded to wait what seemed to be 45 minutes or so. When we brought it to a waiters attention, all she said was the kitchen was busy then leaves. Our food finally comes and we mentioned it to our waiter who simply said I&#39;m sorry then ignored us. <br><br>I understand the kitchen gets busy but I would expect a better response from the waiters when there&#39;s a complaint about the wait. Oh yea, they brought the wrong food to my dad too.

Dadeland Mall&#39;s Cheesecake Factory is weak. It is especially weak when I compare it to Aventura&#39;s Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I had a pretty good experience at Aventura recently. Their happy hour foods were surprisingly good overall and it inspired me to try Dadeland&#39;s. <br><br>While the Chicken Sliders $5.50 were big and appetizing at Aventura, at Dadeland they were a joke. As you&#39;ll see from one of my photos, one chicken patty was hastily ripped in half to make two sliders. One of the chicken pieces was so small, it was basically a single bite.<br><br>The Portabella, Avocado, and Zucchini fries $6.95 are extremely greasy. I couldn&#39;t continue eating them. The Guacamole $5.50 on our first visit to Dadeland was okay. The Mojito $5.50 was fine. The S&#39;mores cheesecake $7.95 was the best dish.<br>______<br><br>On our second visit to Dadeland&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, the Guacamole $5.50 was very unappetizing looking. It had a very obvious brown/oxidized color to it. I thought that it was only brown on the top layer, but it was brown throughout. I dug deeper in several spots in the dish and it was all oxidized. I&#39;m guessing they had a vat of old guacamole and made sure to send it to anyone who ordered off the happy hour menu. To top it off, I bit into the little nub of the avocado. That was unpleasant. This time we ordered it mild and it still had a bizarre spicy taste. It didn&#39;t taste like any type of chili I&#39;ve tried before. It wasn&#39;t black pepper either. It tasted like it had been seasoned with pepper spray (the self -defense kind) or something. Very strange.<br><br>The grossest thing we ate were the Beer Battered French Fries $6.95. Avoid this dish. It was nothing like we expected. I expected beer battered fries like those that are served with fried fish at a British pub. Instead, it was like they slow cooked the hefty potato sticks in barely warm oil first. Then they battered them with a thick and strange breading and fried it at too low of a temperature. The outside of the &#34;fries&#34; was technically crispy, but they were somehow not tasty. I usually love fried food, but the thoroughly oil-soaked fry was a huge disappointment. <br><br>I had tried the Ahi Tuna Tartare at Aventura and was looking forward to it here. The miniscule amount of tartare $7.95 was insulting. All of the tartare could fit inside one of those little plastic cups they use for ketchup. I still can&#39;t believe I just didn&#39;t send the dish back upon seeing it. <br><br>The Happy Hour Burger $5.50 was pretty basic.<br><br>The only redeeming part of this particular meal was the Oreo Dream Cheesecake $7.95. At least the kitchen doesn&#39;t touch this dish. The cheesecake counter people just put a little bit of whipped cream next to it.<br><br>I didn&#39;t think chain restaurants could vary so much. Dadeland Mall&#39;s location is skimpy on portions and the food is not properly cooked and/or their recipes are bad. If you really want Cheesecake Factory food, then I would suggest the Aventura or Dolphin Mall locations.

Doesn&#39;t even deserve one star. I HATE TO LEAVE YET ANOTHER BAD REVIEW. but this time there was a roach IN MY FOOD A LIVE ROACH!!!!!!!!!  The manger was called to our table, he did apologize many times and said the problem would be taken care of and also comped our whole meal. He did seem sincere and apologetic. I LOVE Cheesecake Factory but this definitely will be the last time I come to this location. There&#39;s always a problem with service here but now a roach???? Today was my last time I will eat here. I felt disgusted and didn&#39;t even want to have dinner anymore. We drove 35 min to come eat here and it was a waste of time. Worst experience EVER!!!!! Someone needs to take action ASAP

The service was quick and nice and the food was typical cheesecake factory quality (good, but nothing spectacular). My four cheese pasta with chicken was lacking in chicken, but my red velvet cheesecake 100% hit the spot. Cheesecake Factory a classic and it is just as satisfying every time, but the portions are huge (as is the case with every cheesecake factory), so you have to kind of mentally prepare ahead of time.

The Cheesecake Factory is known worldwide for its deserts and this particular restaurant does not disappoint. I came from Miami Beach to escape the crowds to Dadeland Mall and came to TCF. <br>As soon as you walk in, the host was very attentive and server was great. Best part of the team was manager Natasha, who is warm, friendly and very sweet. I ordered a burger, fries and iced tea. She came over to my table to check that I had all the condiments, drinks full and that everything was good. I LOVE HER! She made my experience so much better and if you go to this restaurant, ask for her... she will treat you nice.

Came here for their Sunday brunch that&#39;s available till 2:00 P.M. unfortunately, today the food and service was not to par. We had a long delay on good, facial hair in my sons plate, and over cooked eggs. Management came out and apologized, but I think the day just didn&#39;t work for us.

great place, however we went yesterday for a birthday reunion (Tuesday) and the service was VERY SLOW..I almost get up and went to the kitchen looking for our waiter dont even know his name....not hispanic........we were there for 3 hours!! not aceptable..and ALSO SUPER LOUD!

In what is usually a generic chain restaurant experience, our server, George, made it a very enjoyable date night for my fiancée and I. He was attentive and courteous on a busy weeknight during holiday season (at a high top in the bar section). We weren&#39;t extremely hungry, so we opted for drinks and appetizers. A cold Blue Moon and Moscow Mule were surprisingly good, although the chicken quesadilla was underwhelming. Thai lettuce wraps were better. Service was great, the food not so much. Would probably come back with a gift card.

Wow where to begin... So to start off let me just say that I was here literally a week ago... I went to lunch today with my family and we decided to come here. We were seated right away which was surprising for a Saturday on a long weekend. <br><br>Our waiter Jonathan came to introduce himself and take our drink orders with bread in hand ( which was great). Once we ordered or drinks it took him a good 10 minutes to come back with them. Mind you, we ordered waters and coca cola&#39;s, nothing fancy that had to be made at the bar. <br><br>When he finally came to drop off the drinks we ordered our food. I ordered the same thing I got one week ago- the Louisiana Chicken Pasta but instead of the sauce the pasta comes with and the veggies I wanted a white sauce (I cannot tell you how many times, in the history of my existence I have ordered this- but since cheesecake used to be my all time favorite restaurant let&#39;s just say A LOT). I&#39;m not sure if Jonathan was new but he seemed quite confused with my order. We asked him to bring more bread as well. <br><br>20 more minutes passed and our drinks were empty and watered down and had just then received the extra bread we had asked for. After 20 more minutes of waiting (still with empty drinks) he finally returned to the table to ask if it was okay with me that the pasta had Cajun butter on it (which is normal to the Louisiana Chicken Pasta dish), which makes the dish spicy, after I had clearly stated I ONLY wanted white sauce. No veggies, not the sauce that it usually comes with, white sauce... Obviously this was not okay with me. He returned to nowhere land or wherever it was that he kept hiding out for about another 20 minutes.<br><br>We were all starving at this point and had been here for an hour already...He finally started bringing out the dishes 2 at a time. Of course everyone else got there food before I did. And when my dish finally came it wasn&#39;t even Jonathan that brought it out! He had someone else bring my dish for me (even though he had brought everyone else&#39;s out and we were 5...) <br><br>Anyways, the food was good. He got my order correct. He finally brought new drinks after we got our food. My grandma complained that her pasta was not cooked enough-it was pretty hard. <br><br>At the end we ordered the smores cheesecake for the table which was delicious!

For the exception of long wait times, I don&#39;t know how this place gets bad reviews.<br><br>I come here pretty often and I always have great experiences. I do always sit at the bar though- so that may make a difference. The bartenders at this location are awesome: very attentive, make great drinks and they are hilarious! The food is always on point and it comes out fast.

Cheesecake Factory is a nice date spot. Very romantic. But during day its an awesome lunch spot. There&#39;s a few things I like about this place. And 1 thing I don&#39;t.<br>they have some of the best lemonades ever. Freshly made behind the bar. No fake stuff. And unlimited refills. They offer free bread which is always yummy. Just wish the butter wasn&#39;t always frozen. <br>Lunch specials are amazing. They offer smaller portions for a more affordable price. They also have Combination plates were you can try two different plates in one. Also available is a skinny menu, which I actually have ordered from and it&#39;s pretty good. Their Saturday and Sunday brunch is one of the best. :Pic:JAMBALAYA HASH &amp; EGGS.(Must try) One of my favorite things about cheesecake factory is they have an amazing salad selection. Some of the most delicious salads ever!! <br>Don&#39;t forget to save room for dessert!! Cheesecake is obviously a must have at the Cheesecake Factory. I have so many favorites, too many to name in this post. Staff is always nice and helpful with the huge menu, <br>Now the things I don&#39;t like about cheesecake factory is when enjoying a cheesecake or one of their pies or desserts,  I like to enjoy that with a cup of coffee. Their coffee is never hot. It always comes out warm. I always have to request to make sure they make it hot. Another thing that I dislike about the cheesecake factory is the bathrooms 9\10 are going to be dirty. There&#39;s always paper all over the floor. Such a beautiful restaurant with bathrooms that don&#39;t match. And of course like I mentioned above the butter is always frozen. So that&#39;s why I took one star away. But all in all a great spot to have lunch or dinner.i
You can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory! I love so many dishes and appetizers there. The strawberry Lemonade is delicious. I love the farfalle pasta with chicken by far.

Food was good. Service was good. The bathroom was extremely disgusting. Management should know that they serve a lot of people and since it&#39;s really busy..someone should attend to the bathroom. The bathroom had a strong odor as if the urine dries up on the floor.
I come here for the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake once a year.... loooooove it so much!

The wait for seating was not bad 5 minutes the most that&#39;s about the only good thing I have to say . Mind you it&#39;s a Tuesday mid day the attention from the waitress was little to almost Nonexistent 20 minutes for her to ask what we would like to order or even bring out some bread  after finally placing the order for 2 we waited a cool hour before even seeing our food. As for the food I was not all that great . I&#39;ll stick to Olive Garden if I  want crappy pasta

This Cheesecake Factory is very good!<br><br>I&#39;ve never had a negative experience other than the wait times. This place gets packed and there&#39;s no calling ahead or making reservations, so just be patient and wait it out. Waiting has become more comfortable now ever since they expanded the restaurant and put more benches in the new waiting area. <br><br>Now onto the rest of the experience....<br>The food here has never disappointed. I&#39;ve had a variety of things and have come with lots of different people and everyone is always very pleased with the food. On my last visit, I tried the Crispy Cuban Rolls &#34;snack&#34; plate as what I thought would be an appetizer, BUT it was more than enough to fill me! Be aware that the portions are proportionally huge (for a snack, it was a pretty big plate; don&#39;t even get me started on how humongous the entrees are). The bread of course is also amazing. I had a drink at the bar once and it was also very good. However, I usually have the strawberry lemonade and it is SO good!! If you&#39;re a lemonade lover, you will NOT be disappointed. It is very sour and sweet -- it&#39;s an absolute &#34;must&#34; every time I come here!<br><br>Service is always absolutely excellent. The restaurant and its restrooms are always very clean as well. If it wasn&#39;t for the long wait times, I&#39;d be coming here a lot more often.

While not my first option, Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t disappoint. With an extensive menu, there are options for all dietary needs (a bit overwhelming at times). Although there is usually a long wait, this is an ideal setting for family dining. The pumpernickel bread always tastes like it&#39;s fresh out of the oven! My favorite meals are the Chicken Madeira and Pasta da Vinci. (If you order the lunch portions you won&#39;t feel as guilty, hah!) And while I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecakes (gasp), the ones I have tasted are yummy. Overall, I would recommend Cheesecake Factory whether for a date night or your next family celebration!

I&#39;ve been to a lot of different Cheesecake Factories and generally the food is okay.  The food here was also serviceable but it was the rude service we had a problem with.  The waitress was unfriendly and did not smile, disappeared for a long time after taking out drink order and never came back after our food came out to see how it was.<br><br>Also the staff was using some very offensive language in earshot of customers, I do t know if they knew or cared there was kids around but I don&#39;t expect to hear racial slurs in casual conversation around me when I dine out.

Very very long wait for call in. Ordered curbside, had to go in and wait an extra 20 mins after calling 25 minutes prior. Asked for extra gravy for chicken and biscuits, they gave me the brown gravy for mash potatoes. Had to wait for them the cook white gravy for my meal, another wait.<br><br>Get with it!

If you&#39;re looking for options, this is the place to go. Menu is endless and has options for any dietary needs.<br> <br>A group of my co-workers and I went out to lunch but not all of us eat the same. We had a couple of vegetarians and a few others that were looking for a &#34;low calorie&#34; meal so we all agreed on TCF.<br> <br>Went in around 11:45 AM to avoid the lunch rush hour. Thankfully the restaurant wasn&#39;t packed so a table for 9 was available within 2 minutes.<br> <br>Our server, Michael T, quickly came to our table and gracefully offered water, took our drinks order, and brought some of that delicious bread. A few minutes later we ordered some appetizers: avocado rolls, fried mac and cheese, and edamame. The three of them were fabulous. (My favorite were the avocado rolls... yummmm!!)<br> <br>After debating for 30 minutes on what to eat (no kidding!), I FINALLY decided to try the bang bang shrimp and chicken with brown rice. Presentation was a plus and portion was big enough to feed 2 people. However, I was a little disappointed when I came to find out that the &#34;bang bang&#34; sauce was not the one I had in mind. This one had a curry/peanut butter taste to it as opposed to the mayo/chili one from Bonefish and PF Changs. Although it was not what I was expecting, dish was still flavorsome and I took the left overs home.<br> <br>To finish our &#34;food coma&#34; meal, we decided to order TWO cheesecakes: red velvet and s&#39;mores. All I can say is that life was a lot better after that.

Went to the cheesecake factory for dinner and ended up not eating there. We waited an hour for our food and when it finally came it was cold. I ordered the Evelyn favorite pasta and it was cold. My friend ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were barely cooked. The waiter said the meals took so long because the kitchen was waiting on one of the meals to be done. An hour for pasta - seriously. I havent been there in over 10 years and I definitely won&#39;t be going back.

Been coming here since I was little and still one of my Go-To favorites. I mean I think this menu has about everything and can satisfy even the pickiest person you know. With such a large menu you can never get bored with the food. Even though for years Ive been stuck ordering the Miso Salmon because its just so good. Some days im feeling a little more sponaneous and order something new. <br><br>Either way, for sure a five star for me. Yes its a popular restaurant so depending on the day sometimes it will be crazy packed and you have to wait. A little tip, if youre with a small party and you see a table open in the bar area then that seating is first come first serve. So you can seat yourself and dine from there.<br><br>THE BREAD IS FIIIIIRE. I always end up just asking for double &#34;brown bread&#34; because that one is my favorite. Just be careful not to kill it all and stuff yourself too much before your meal. Their plates tend to run a little on the bigger side. <br><br>I know its called cheese cake factory.... but I love their strawberry shortcake for dessert! mmm I&#39;m hungry.

Always a filling meal when craving Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Food 3/5<br>The menu is overwhelming at time because it&#39;s so extensive! Fave dish is the white chicken chili- comfort food yet light on calories, doesn&#39;t make you feel blehhh afterwards! The portions at cheesecake are huge!! Once had the chicken parm pizza and leftovers were enough for like another 3 servings! The food itself is never too memorable though, nothin really unique to their dishes. <br>Tried the new coffee n cream cheesecake, quite yummy! <br><br>Service 4/5 <br>The wait is always unbelievable whether it be weeknights or weekends! They definitely try to be efficient, it&#39;s just the shear number of people there that causes this. Our server was friendly and advised us to put in our cheesecake orders before our food because it was taking 1hr to prep cheesecakes- good call! <br><br>Ambiance 3/5 <br>It&#39;s really loud all the time and hard to hear conversations at your own table. The kithchen staff are also a bit rowdy (at least they are enjoying their time!)

If you know me, you know that one of my fave go-to restaurants is Cheesecake!! Not only does is have a wide variety of foodie options but it also has the best dessert and fresh quality foods no matter what you get! I usually get pasta but have strayed away from that and broadened my choices and I&#39;ve never once been disappointed!! I seriously love this place no matter what I&#39;m in the mood for
Was amazing as usual server was nice even with the restaurant being very crowded. Food was amazing Price reasonable and it&#39;s located inside the mall which made it even better

At one time Cheesecake Factory was a great spot. Sadly, it has really gone down hill. I came for lunch to celebrate my birthday and overall it was just a disappointing experience. To start, the silverware was FILTHY. Disgustingly so. There were hard pieces of food stuck to almost every fork on the table and the knives had film on them. We brought it to our server&#39;s attention and the manager Linda promptly came to our table to apologize. She offered a complimentary entree or dessert, which was nice. However, the lunch experience continued to go downhill. The wait for our meals was entirely too long and the food was mediocre. My husband had the chicken teriyaki, which was dry, bland, and barely had any sauce on the chicken. For almost $17 it should be better... My chicken quesadilla was just ok. The cheesecake is always good, but don&#39;t think I haven&#39;t noticed the slices getting smaller and smaller- yet the price remains the same. Tsk, tsk. At the end of the meal, we had to remind the waiter of the comp the manager had promised. <br>I have not been impressed at all my past few visits to Cheesecake Factory (Dadeland location and Grove location) and I think at this point, I will not be returning further.

I&#39;ve eaten at 4 CCF&#39;s in San Francisco, Philadelphia, Coconut Grove, and Dadeland. Undeniably, their cheesecakes are the best I&#39;ve had. As for the rest of their extensive menu, although no one item has stood out as &#34;Thee Best I&#39;ve ever had,&#34; each franchise I&#39;ve visited exhibits a high degree of consistent very good quality of food for which the nationwide chain is to be commended. On my recent visit to the Dadeland CCF, arriving at 5PM on a Monday, we were immediately seated. Drinks, apps, and entrees were all served promptly like a well-oiled machine. Our server, Ana, was competent, professional and personable. Things I didn&#39;t like which cost them a star...1) I think $6.50 for a bottle of Heineken during HappyHour is a tad high. 2) Although my shrimp scampi was very delicious, they only give 3 shrimp with the scampi/steak Diane combo. I think 1 or 2 more wouldn&#39;t bankrupt them. 3) Clandestinely, I advised the (lackluster)hostess who seated us that it was my wife&#39;s birthday. She acknowledged me, yet at the end of the meal, no Happy Birthday greeting. I concocted a ruse to excuse myself from the table to contact Ana the server, who said the hostess hadn&#39;t told her anything. Luckily, Ana and her colleagues got together and gave a great HB song to wifey. I feel the hostess should put forth more effort working at a restaurant of this caliber.  All in all, especially for a special occasion dinner, the consistent quality of CCF virtually guarantees a successful dining experience.

This place was not clean at all. All the silverware at the table was dirty, and the service was awful. We requested the table bread and when brought to us, it was hard as a rock. You can tell it was sitting for a very long time.

Went to lunch here on a Saturday. The wait was not long, less then 5 minutes. Once we were seated the waiter, Frank, came over and introduced himself. Frank was amazing, he was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped me find a tasty vegetarian option. The table next to us was rude to him, but by the end of the visit they quickly turned their negative attitude around as they noticed he did not change his mood. The food did take pretty long to come out. Frank did continue to check on us, but when our food did come the appetizer came out with the food. Overall good experience here, Frank was amazing but the wait for food was too long.
We&#39;ve been to this restaurant on many occasions with friends and family and always have received excellent service,
