We were not greeted for 15 minutes after first being seated.  Finally, someone briskly walked by and dropped a basket of bread on our table! but didn&#39;t stop to greet us.  Another 15 minutes go by, and I realize the bread dropper is our waiter who is ready to take our entire order appetizer and main entrees (rushing us).  Food took about 25 minutes, but hey, at least we were munching on bread that was stale on this visit, probably previous customers&#39; uneaten bread.  When the food finally arrived, I knew I would need to ask our waiter for soda refills now because I wouldn&#39;t see him again until the check came.  And I was right about that.  We decided not to order dessert from this waiter because we had waited long enough for the check; instead, we paid the check and purchased a to-go slice of cheesecake at the front of the house.<br>The service here was even worse if you can imagine:  A heavyset guy behind the counter had me pay.  Then he got out what looked like a broom and was sweeping the floor, and without washing his hands, prepared our piece of cheesecake in a to-go container with a wrapped piece of Godiva chocolate he pressed against the cake and whipped cream.  And he threw some napkins and unwrapped plastic forks in the bag.  There were two women working with him who were huddled together while laughing about something, either what he was doing or laughing amongst themselves about something else.  I was so turned off I don&#39;t think we&#39;ll be eating at this location anytime soon in the future.
Updating my last visit . Management reached out and looked positive to remedy the situation. Good gesture and of course i will return you can never get enough Cheesecake Factory!
Dinner with William today! Enjoyed my favorite stuffed mushrooms paired with the amazing service provided throughout my dinner! My ideal date gets 11/10!!

Love coming to the Cheesecake Factory. This chain restaurant has one of the biggest menus I have ever seen.  Their sweetcorn tamales is a must have  they are delicious. One of my favorite plates is the chicken costaleta. I really enjoy the way the chicken is cooked. Their dessert menu has so many options for everyone. They have an impressive amount of cheesecake options and also other types of desserts.<br><br>The service at cheesecake os very good the waiter was always attentive and gave us various suggestions on the food<br>The floor can be kind of greasy so be careful when walking to your seat, I have seen various people slip.

Our family loves Cheesecake Factory but lately the dadeland location has been lacking in cleanliness and the servers don&#39;t seem happy anymore. We came for lunch today they aren&#39;t busy but still the table setting was dirty and the sever wasn&#39;t happy that we ordered appetizers and desert. Not what it used to be.

I love Cheesecake Factory because of it is always consistent in delivering the same flavor every time. Although they have many amazing dishes, my absolute favorite is the Pasta Davincci. I order it every time! <br><br>The place is always busy, by service seems to be pretty good most of the time. They always try to accommodate and if they notice themselves falling short, they make up for it. We the Sunday brunch has a become a regular for us. The fried chicken eggs Benedict is amazing and our 2 year old loooooves the kids pancakes with bacon! Our go to location is normally the one at Dadeland.

Worst service ever!!!! We were having dinner tonight in a table at the bar area, against the wall. The waiter came to the table after we waited about 15 min. He forgot the drinks, the food arrived after more than 1/2 hour, my husband asked for ketchup and never got it. He didn&#39;t care at all about us, and never apologized. <br>Terrible service!!!!! Next time I&#39;ll think twice to go back...

For the longest time, my family and I would have lunch here every Saturday. Their drinks are good. Their food is good. Their customer service is good as well. I can&#39;t really complain about anything, aside from the bathrooms. They are usually messy and missing toilet paper. If you don&#39;t care about that, Cheesecake is a good place.

The girl who sat us had 0 customer service skills &amp; didn&#39;t want to be there. She was rolling her eyes as she was walking back from the table where we are supposed to sit. Utensils on the table were dirty. Both of these reasons led us to leave immediately.

I went alone for lunch at 1:45. No line, no waiting then the kitchen took 45 min for one order of steak medallions. Really?  I should have just walked after 30 min but I wanted to see how it was going to end.  Not well. No discount, no comped cookie no nothing. The food was generic and good though.

Cheesecake is my favorite restaurant in the whole world!! This is my favorite location. The food is always good and the service is excellent. The sweet corn tamale cakes are the bomb!! You must try! Also the avocado egg rolls are delicious!! My favorite meat dish is the hibachi steak. So juicy and sweet and full of flavor! My favorite chicken dish is the spicy cashew chicken. WOW!! This dish is also very flavorful and not too spicy. You can have any dessert here and it will be amazing. The strawberry lemonade is also very good to try.

Our server was William and he was absolutely awesome!!! I have a ton of food allergies and he literally wrote them all and was super accommodating. Thank you so much for making my dinner such a pleasant experience!

We just had dinner here and one of the hostesses brought a party of three to a table near us. The table was dirty, there was some rice and pasta on it. She grabbed some type of rag and without spraying any kind of disinfectant she smeared all the food all over the table.  We could see the food stuck on the table. Anyhow, she put napkins and plates on it and they sat down. This restaurant also puts the utensils right on the table surface not even in a napkin. The problem here aside from how disgusting it is, is that this a a health violation.  GROSS.

I can&#39;t complain about the food here - it&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory and everything is delicious! My favorite is the truffle bacon grilled cheese sticks - a must try! <br><br>However, this particular location I&#39;ve been to many many times, and it seems to have a pattern with poor waitstaff. Only once have I had a great waitress here. The problem typically revolves around timing, where we sit there for about 20 minutes after we&#39;re done eating, waiting for a waiter to check on us or hand us a check. <br><br>I wish this wasn&#39;t a recurring issue, or I would visit much more often than I do.

My mom loves this place so it&#39;s like a tradition to go every other year and celebrate her birthday. This year we decided to try the Dadeland location to see a different scenario and boy do we regret it. I thought given the fact that it&#39;s located in Dadeland Mall, the service would be a little more high quality but it&#39;s actually pretty bad. First of, our server took forever to take our drinks order and didn&#39;t even bring water. I am a huge fan of their appetizers and specially the nachos, this time I was disappointed; the nachos were burnt and it barely had any toppings in them. Our server was the worse but I still left an 18% tip because I hate to be a shitty tipper. We were sat by a plate station on the &#34;outside&#34; area and the buss boy was a mess, he was throwing dishes and making a lot of noise , at some point a guest who was next to us decided to complain but it didn&#39;t really matter until he had to ask for the manager and ended up leaving. Our food was really w.e but what really annoys me the most is that our server would be even pick up the plates or glasses that were empty. We were 4 on a small table and the whole time our table was full of dishes making it almost impossible to eat. We are probably not confine back to this location but it definitely needs work on their service and food. I

I&#39;m no stranger to The Cheesecake Factory, but I must say that I&#39;m ashamed that I knew nothing about the Saturday and Sunday Brunch Menu (served from 10am-2pm)! A large group of colleagues and myself decided to partake in some Sunday brunch festivities after our morning meeting &amp; I must say that I was thoroughly impressed. Miami has an impeccable selection of eateries for brunch, so I was a bit hesitant as to how good the selection of food would be. The brunch menu is simple yet perfect in its own way; everything ranging from giant Belgian waffles to brûléed French toast. I highly recommend the Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict as well as the Monte Cristo Sandwich. Our server was delightful &amp; made excellent recommendations for the entire party of 20. And let&#39;s not forget about those amazing cocktails. I&#39;m giving this first time experience two thumbs way up.

Cheesecake factory  offers consistent quality of meals each time we go :-) this particular  location is very crowded and busy so goodluck squeezing I  through the door and finding the line to check in. <br><br>My go-to plate is the thai  lettuce wraps. They are absolutely delicious and do not make you feel terribly full afterward. Try your wraps with the peanut sauce, yum!<br><br>On this particular visit our waiter was very helpful. Although he seemed very busy he still tried his best to help us with what we needed and with a positive disposition. <br><br>I recommend  eating here on a weekday at earlier hours otherwise prepare to be pushed and shoved out of the way by fellow patrons. They have got to figure out how to make the check in process more efficient because right now it&#39;s a mess.
Poor service on takeout line waiting more than ten minutes now<br>Poor service on takeout<br>Poor service on takeout

If you like overpriced, cold food the Cheesecake factory is for you. We started off with 2 appetizers. Fried mac and cheese which was ok, however it was served with a creamy marinara sauce that was ice cold. Thought maybe that is how is should be served but we asked the server and it was supposed to be hot. The second appetizer was guacamole and chips. Not sure how an avocado and a handful of chips cost $12.00. The meal came out and the pot pie was cold and the crust resembled a hockey puck. The skinny enchiladas tasted like the sauce was a marinara sauce. It was sweet and the enchiladas were dry. The diet coke was the only thing that tasted like it should. The waiter was attentive.  I have not been to the Cheesecake Factory in years and now I know why. Expensive, cheap tasting food.

We were excited to have our family member try Cheesecake Factory in Dadeland Mall. We decided to do curve side order. We order Avocado Egg rolls and Buffalo Chicken Strips and a slice of cheesecake. After 45 minutes of waiting outside my fiancé decided to go inside to see what was taking so long. He was told another 15-20 minutes. We receive our food and what a disappointment, avocado was brown very cold and chicken was dry. One of our family member is a chef and could not believe how the food looks. They couldn&#39;t eat it. So upsetting and the wait was too long.

I always really liked this location but service this Sunday was abysmal. When ordering to-go I was placed on hold indefinitely and completely forgotten about. That should have tipped me off but I called back and placed my order for curbside pickup. When I arrived I was again placed on an indefinite hold. I went inside to pick up my order which was sitting on the side and getting cold. When they handed it to me they told me I could not pay because they didn&#39;t have my ticket (even though it was a very simple order to charge)-understandable. <br>But while waiting I looked at my order of shrimp scampi with herb crusted salmon and mashed potatoes. It was smooshed together in a big lump of mash. Horribly packed and definitely thrown around. The salmon was overcooked yet the whole dish had gotten cold. Total waste of money. Should have been free. Very disappointing.

One star because I have to. First of all the service was terrible and the food even worse. Not to mention my dirty martini sucked, it had ice in it......The food came on the dirtiest plate I&#39;ve ever seen. We sent the food back and got the hell out of there...... DISGUSTING!!!

I went with some of my friends to celebrate a birthday. The hostesses were very polite and friendly, great service there! They were able to find seating for our party of 10 promptly, which was great!<br>However, once we were seated we had a very lack luster experience with the waitress. She did not smile once our entire meal and just generally seemed irritated. When my friend asked if they had cinnamon, she was quick to reply with &#34;What for?&#34; in a rude tone rather than answer her request. I mean she did her job of taking our orders and refilling our drinks and such but her demeanor was off putting, especially since she was the only server we saw there without a good attitude.<br>We had asked for them to do the birthday thing where they sing for you as they bring out the cheesecake which was very nice of them!<br>Food was great! I had the Chicken Marsala and Mushroom Pasta which was fantastic, although I wish they had the option for a smaller portion. I also had the Salted Caramel Cheesecake which was to die for! Best Cheesecake I&#39;ve tried so far!

By far one of the best places to have a creamy delicious pasta bowl. <br><br>They have a pretty long menu which at times makes it hard to decide what I wish to eat, but whichever dish you choose you will NOT be disappointed. The service is usually fast (weekends do expect long wait times and many people) but nonetheless, everything here taste great. To start they serve fresh warm bread (I love the dark one) and also monday- Friday they have great happy hour deals. <br><br>As for dessert..... you just need to get here NOW and see for yourself. The cheesecakes are delicious. Every possible creation handcrafted ready for a delicious taste.

Right now I have two major regrets in life:<br><br>1) Setting foot into the Dadeland Mall Cheesecake Factory, WHICH I WILL NEVER DO AGAIN. <br><br>2) Not taking photos of all the atrocities that took place last night during my dinner there, which I DEEPLY regret because now I can&#39;t properly shame and humiliate this disgusting excuse of a restaurant.  If I had a time machine I would so go back in time to last night so I could photo-document my horrible experience and then post it for all eternity on the internet.<br><br>The ONLY nice thing I can say about the Dadeland CF is that despite the fact that it was a busy Saturday night, our party of three was seated within 10 minutes.  THATS IT. Everything else was a total sh*t show.  I am now going to verbally annihilate this restaurant.  <br><br>1) The men&#39;s room was absolutely freaking disgusting: wadded, dirty paper towels everywhere.  EVERYWHERE.  Trash cans overflowing.  Every toilet had piss on the seat and feces smeared on the bowl.  The mirrors were dirty.  AN OLD MAN WAS WASHING HIS FREAKING HAIR IN THE SINK. There was what looked like a freaking COLOSTOMY BAG ON THE FLOOR.  The minute I set foot in the men&#39;s room, I felt like what any woman would feel like if she downed a bottle of vodka and a bunch of roofies and then went knocking on Brett Kavanaugh&#39;s dorm room.  The raunchiest gay bareback porn I&#39;ve ever seen is still not half as filthy as this CF&#39;s mens room.  I hope the manager is reading this: CLEAN YOUR FREAKING BATHROOM.  <br><br>2) Our waiter was inattentive and slow the entire night.  I ordered the Southwest Chicken Sandwich and the chicken came ice cold.  I complained to our incompetent waiter that I&#39;m not paying $20 (extra chicken) for cold meat, and told him to take it away and give me a hot sandwich.  After a 10 minute wait, a different (female) waiter appeared and sassed me, saying that &#34;the chef says that this is supposed to be a cold sandwich.&#34;  Look woman, don&#39;t freaking sass me: I&#39;ve ordered this same sandwich 20 damn times at various CF&#39;s and the chicken is always hot.  Don&#39;t piss on my leg and tell me it&#39;s raining.  DONT ARGUE WITH A CUSTOMER. She then says, in this pompous-ass tone of voice, &#34;we can MAKE it hot for you IF YOU WANT&#34; -- as if I&#39;m freaking Miranda Priestly making the most OUTRAGEOUS demands of the entire kitchen staff by expecting a HOT sandwich.  As if I&#39;m the freaking Sultan of Bhaggar with emeralds and diamonds and rubies stuck all over me, expecting people to reach for the stars in order to meet my OUTRAGEOUS demands for a HOT sandwich.  <br><br>3) After what I can only assume was our idiot waiter trekking to the freaking PURDUE CHICKEN FARM IN NEBRASKA to get more chicken, I finally get a hot sandwich 20 years later... served with my old fries, which are now ALSO ice cold, due to the long wait.  How freaking stupid can you be?  I&#39;M NOT EATING COLD FRIES.  So then I have to wait AGAIN for hot fries. The other two people I was with are both done with their meals by this point, mind you, so my dinner experience has been pretty much totally ruined at this point due to Dadeland CF&#39;s total bumbling incompetence and inability to serve A CHICKEN SANDWICH.  God forbid I had ordered the Rack of Lamb or something more complex, 24 hours later I would probably still be at my table waiting for these idiots to get it right.<br><br>4) However, the single worst thing was the other people in the restaurant, and this is why I will never give this restaurant my money again.  Dear CF Manager: I&#39;m deeply confused right now: are you running a restaurant or a freaking daycare for the unwashed masses of Miami?  Because the sheer volume of NONSTOP SCREAMING CHILDREN, some of which were literally running around the booths, who were so loud that I couldn&#39;t even carry a conversation with THE PEOPLE AT MY OWN TABLE, really has me confused about what exactly you&#39;re running here.  Look, I really don&#39;t have a problem with kids in restaurants, especially &#34;family&#34; restaurants like C-Factories.   I *do* have a problem with parents who don&#39;t reel in their screaming brats when said brats are clearly ruining the dining experience of total strangers in a public space.  I have a BIGGER problem with a restaurant&#39;s management that clearly could not give less of a crap about this kind of situation ruining other people&#39;s dining experience.  IT IS NOT MY JOB TO ASK TOTAL STRANGERS TO STFU AND CONTROL THEIR KIDS IN YOUR RESTAURANT.  This is the single biggest reason I would rather eat glass than go to this place EVER again: not one member of the staff asked these people to please control your screaming misbehaving brats.  Have some freaking courtesy and respect for a public experience.  <br><br>TL, DR: avoid at all costs.  I would seriously rather starve than go back to this cesspool.

I went here yesterday to celebrate my father&#39;s birthday with family &amp; It went really well. I ordered the Almond-Crusted Salmon Salad &amp; substituted the pan seared salmon with grilled salmon instead. The salad was delicious! The appetizer I ordered was the Guacamole &amp; Chips. I&#39;m not into guacamole at all but the guacamole that came in this appetizer was very tasty. I recommend this location if you live in the area or just in the area generally.
Went here with my family on a Sunday night. Only waited ten mins to sit. I ordered the Farfalle pasta with chicken and roasted garlic. Not too salty, fulfilling and very yummy. Huge portions!

Definitely a good spot, but not &#34;great&#34;. The Mac and cheese is pretty flavor less, but the Chicken Parmigiana (Pizza Style) is good. I&#39;ve been here a few times and it&#39;s my favorite dish that I&#39;ve tried. The serving portions are pretty big and definitely filling.
My girlfriend is vegetarian and trust me, it&#39;s hard for me to find good options for her....but....she loved the green lasagna here!!! Coming back soon definitely

The more I go to cheesecake the more disappointed I get. I&#39;ve had an issue with the one in Dolphin Mall since it opened up and now I&#39;ve noticed the Dadeland Mall having the same issues. Dirty and stinky restrooms, distrust cups, utensils, and plates. And problems with the food the majority of the time. And not only a problem with what is ordered but the quality of the food has gone way down. <br><br>My family and I headed over yesterday for Easter Sunday. 8 of us and half had a problem with our orders. It was absolutely not the waiters fault he was more than wonderful with us even after all our issues. It was absolutely not the waiters fault he was more than great with us after all. My sister and I also noticed that the white bread has changed. <br><br>We have been regulars at cheesecake since we were little girls back in the 90s so we notice the change tremendously. I did notice the managers walking around a lot... apparently a lot of customers had complaints yesterday.<br><br> I&#39;m so disappointed with Cheesecake Factory mostly because this is the place I&#39;ve gone too for so long and it&#39;s picked first automatically by my family and friends. It&#39;s a no brainier and now we have to second guess it.<br><br>I&#39;ve always believed chain restaurants have all the same problem. The more you grow the less quality and service you give. 20 years ago Cheesecake Factory locations were not everywhere and sure enough not more than 1 maybe 2 locations in each city as I remembered. Chain restaurants have been out my options for a good 6 years now. As an adult I&#39;ve learned to not waste my money on them and when I find a dead end and must step foot in one it hurts. There are a handful amount of chain restaurants I am okay with and Cheesecake Factory was definitely one. <br><br>.

The food is okay at best.  Varied menu is good.  The drinks are expensive and prices not published.  Great cheesecakes except that I stopped eating sweets so really no reason to go there again.  Parents don&#39;t control their kids so got to enjoy unruly kid banging silverware on table and punching the bench seat the entire time I tried to enjoy my meal.

Was shopping at Dadeland Mall and decided to go have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s always been one of my favorites. <br>I wanted to order something light because I&#39;m trying to lose some lbs. I was surprised that they now have a skinny menu that also tells you how much calories each meal has. <br>My order was simple a small ceasar salad and from the skinny menu a tuna tartar that was delicious in a reasonable portion. My son ordered the chicken teriyaki with white rice (his favorite) and he felt that the chicken was a little dry and was not made with love. My partner ordered the almond salmon salad that has Kale but he was not so thrilled with his meal. We love coming here but we stepped out of our comfort zone from what we usually order. The wait for this restaurant is forever long. Please try to reserve. Prices are also reasonable.

Anthony is such an awesome server! He is extremely knowledgeable about the menu and very attentive! He is so hospitable and delivers perfect service! He has exceeded our expectations tremendously! Thank you for making our experience the best!

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at this location. Service is fast for how busy they are. <br><br>My favorite dish is the miso salmon but replace the rice with mashed potatoes. The salmon is never under or over cooked and it&#39;s my go to dish <br><br>For appetizers I highly recommend the Thai lettuce wraps.

Ordered food for pick up thru curbside. Waited for 15 minutes, I called twice and they hung up on me. A manager had to be called in order to get the order and even then had to wait another 10 min. Last time I order take out

I&#39;m not even sure where to begin, the entire experience was extremely horrible.  First, I wanted to make a reservation over the phone, and they told me that they could not do that.  Then, I asked them how to make a reservation, and the man I spoke to said, &#34;oh, I was never trained with that stuff.  All I know is that you can make it through Yelp&#34;.  So right off the bat, their service was very poor, and none of the employees knew how to make a simple reservation.  When I arrived, we had to wait for 20 minutes, EVEN THOUGH we made a reservation in advance.  Next was the almost hour and a half wait for the food, not to mention the incredibly rude attitude our waitress had.  Also, our menus were very dirty, and when I explained it to the waitress, she just sighed annoyed by what I had to say.  Disappointing.  The soup we had ordered took over and hour to arrive, and was served to us cold.  When we asked them to heat it up, it returned even colder than before, and that&#39;s no exaggeration.  When I informed the manager, he simply said, &#34;I&#39;m so sorry to hear that.&#34;  I mean at least pretend to show some sort of intention of improving the service and processing our kind feedback.  Lastly, we had ordered a dish in advance, to be ready when we finished eating and be able to take it to go, but it wasn&#39;t ready for another 30 minutes after we finished eating ourselves!  I will NEVER return to this establishment again, and I recommend you choose to dine elsewhere.
My food was delicious and my husband also enjoyed his dish. The portions are huge, so it&#39;s a plus to always have leftovers for later. We also love the bread and the service was great.

Amazing service! I believe the server I had is named Jorge M or something like that. He always attended to me and my tables needs. Since it was my first time, I asked him what he recommended. I love spicy food so he recommended the Louisiana pasta. He did not disappoint. Amazing. Amazing. I will be coming back and I hope I can request him again

Have eaten at mini cheesecake factories went last night for dinner so disappointed not only in our server but also in the way management handled our situation one out of two dinners came out manager came over to apologize that my meal would be out shortly my girlfriend was just about finished with her dinner and mine still was not in front of me so I shared what was left of her mail nothing was offered as a compensation management basically shrugged off the whole situation so terribly disappointed first time ever<br>Not leaving a gratuity

So, if you&#39;re in for a 1,000 calorie salad, this might be your spot. I&#39;ll admit, the decor is somewhat nice, obviously a recurring theme with all Cheesecake Factory restaurants, however, it definitely looks pretentious. Now, their overly-priced cheesecakes are indeed delicious- that I will admit. On a cheat day, you bet I would pick up a cheesecake, but not from Cheesecake Factory, there are better cheesecakes elsewhere. The service here is terrible, there has even been recent news on this place being extremely racist, prejudice, and the like. Being in Miami, I have had better cheesecakes from Fireman Derek&#39;s! Now that&#39;s a cheesecake worth buying into! I&#39;m not into paying for $15 fatty salads, and any intentions I had on bring my family to try them out has now gone out the window. This place is simply an upscale Chilis sans the customer service.

You can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. <br>Came here on a busy Sunday took about 25 minutes to be seated, I&#39;m impressed! <br>The only issue was everything took a very long time to come out, the drinks, entree, dessert, even the bread took awhile. <br>Each thing took about 20-25 minutes to come out, and yes I was counting. <br>The drinks were great, the food was better, and the bread of course was the best!<br>Wish they gave out more than three slices though I mean it&#39;s just so good! <br>The staff was super friendly and it added to the experience. They came out and sang happy birthday which was nice. <br>Unfortunately, we ordered a warm apple crisp and it took awhile to come out and when it finally came it was cold...the manager came out and apologized sincerely and offered to bring more bread. <br>It was really sweet. <br>Overall a really great experience, even with the construction going on outside... I&#39;m shocked at their attention to detail.

Been to this location inside Dadeland Mall 3 times, once was like almost 10 years ago when they first opened the second time was a mistake and the third time was because I had a gift card and it was free. All times were TERRIBLE!!! Well except for the third time and that&#39;s because I was smart enough to use my gift card on just drinks rather than their mediocre food.<br>       When I first came here the Cheesecake Factory just opened it was back in about 2004, so it was like a big deal. The line to get in was ridiculous but since this place was so popular I waited. Finally after an hour wait I went in ordered our food only to be disappointed  by the most bland food I had ever eaten.  After that I vowed to never eat there again. <br>  A few years later after shopping at Dadeland Mall I decided to give it a second chance. Wait time wasn&#39;t as long this time but sure enough the same dull bland food had not changed a bit and to top it all off the food came along with a side of extremely douchey waiters. So this time I was serious NEVER AGAIN. <br>       Until of course someone gave me a Cheesecake Factory gift card that they didn&#39;t want. So last year after finishing my Christmas shopping at the mall I went to the CCF but this time I went there to drink and not eat, I figured I didn&#39;t have to spend a dime and I had free drinks. The drinks weren&#39;t terrible but after spending the whole $50.00 gift card and having to deal with these douchey Kendall waiters I was only slightly buzzed. Regardless this place is mediocre at best. I&#39;ve never had a good meal here the service sucks and the drinks are weak. NEVER AGAIN! Unless of course someone gives me another gift card but aside from that I would never waste my money here again.
Great service from Jorge! The food came out perfect, just as ordered, and the server was extremely attentive. Best Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;ve had yet!

I started off hating this Cheesecake Factory  based on the horrible parking and the insane amount of people there. It&#39;s like nobody works! Surprisingly our wait time was only 10 minutes for a booth and we were greeted promptly by an EXCELLENT server named Colleen. <br><br>    The restaurant itself is VERY noisy and crowded, undisciplined kids running all over the place and selfish parents that think it&#39;s cute. However we noticed that it does die down after 3PM (mental note) Colleen our server was very friendly and wore a genuine smile throughout our lunch. <br><br>    Their was a slight hiccup with our order, but the manager was kind enough to inform us on the mistake and made every effort to accommodate us while we waited. Even with the slight delay in our food I have to say I really enjoyed it here, mostly due to our great server and the funny Manager who made our experience a pleasant one. <br><br>    The Cheesecake Factory has always been a consistent place to eat with reasonable prices and generous portions. My Chicken Carbonara was excellent! And their Chicken Picatta is wonderful! Make sure you take advantage of the lunch portions served until 5PM, unless you have a big appetite then go for the dinner portion. <br><br>    As usual I cannot leave without dessert so being the wild, crazy and spontaneous guy that I am I ordered the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake! Yum!

Ok...we were a large party, seated in the enclosed patio area. It was sooo cold, other tables were complaining also. I couldn&#39;t enjoy my food, table was so cold i didn&#39;t want to touch it.  The manager said they could only control the ceiling fans, which did little. The music was so loud, we could hardly talk at our table. I&#39;m not sure if the food was good, it was too cold. Service was so-so. We would have stayed longer and had drinks relaxed...We couldn&#39;t. Too cold, too loud.

My daughter&#39;s birthday party was awesome at the Cheesecake Factory. We had a party of 11 and only waited 15 minutes to sit. The service was fast and the food was delicious. The server was nice and communicated with everyone in my party. Wish I could remember his name. He had a big beard and short hair. He was awesome

Love this restaurant. Never a disappointment. Huge menu with an infinite amount of options, food always tastes amazing. It&#39;s above a casual atmosphere, but under a fine dinning one, I would say its right in the middle. Service is always great. Oh cant forget to point out the size of their portions...very generous with their servings. One of my top go to restaurants and always have a great time when I visit. Keep up the great work Cheese Cake!

Had an ok experience. The Cheesecake Factory used to be my favorite restaurant growing up, now, I feel like the food and service can go either way. There is always a wait, weekday or not, and it is just a bit too packed and loud for my taste --depending on mood.<br><br>This last visit went just &#34;ok&#34;. They walked us over to our table, to find that it was not been whipped down or set. Bread was not offered, turns out that for lunch &#34;one must request it&#34;. Ordered a vegan salad, dressing was a bit overpowering but ok, overall. Shrimp dish was a bit overcooked, tasted ok, overall. Had cheesecake to go, and that was pretty good. <br><br>I don&#39;t love it, but I also don&#39;t hate it.

Honestly! When you go to TCF you expect good food and fast and today they sure delivered! Our waitress Caty was wonderful and the manager Natasha was so professional and made sure we left very happy. Thanks you!

Good food, very good attention. I picked this place for my son birthday and was not dissapointed. The menu has so many choices that you dont want to eat just one entree, but the sizes of each are just perfect. I will come here again and again. Prices may be high but the quality and taste of food deserves the price.

I love Cheesecake Factory  never really had a bad experience here. It&#39;s a great place for dinner there&#39;s options for everyone . My favorite dish there is the kale salad and chicken costeleta omg delish. The miso salmon is also amazing. And the brown bread is my favvvvv. The staff here is very nice compared to the aventura location <br><br>One thing I must say about Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m talking about ALL locations something I find so weird is the fact that the floor is soooooo slippery. In everyone I&#39;ve been to. <br><br>Must go!

One of the frustrating things about having an hour lunch is that it usually means we have to rush in and out of a restaurant for lunch (especially if we need to drive to get there). Normally, this means that if we are late getting out of the office, we can run 5-10 minutes late getting back. <br><br>Today, against my wishes, the team wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory and I begrudgingly obliged. Luckily, we left on time so I felt good, considering this location is 0.6 miles from my office. <br><br>As mentioned, We are on a time crunch due to work. The food orders were taken and brought to us in a timely manner. Most of it was prepared correctly - my co-worker&#39;s santa fe salad came without the ordered chicken and the lack of attentiveness by the waiter made him have to wait quite a bit just to advise that the chicken didn&#39;t arrive. Then he waited. He waited long enough, in fact, that the chicken was brought out at the same time as the to-go boxes. The remaining salad and chicken was boxed up to go. Also, the wait time for the desserts (placed as a to-go order when the boxes came) was exorbitant - nearly 10 minutes. Add another 10 minute wait for the check and yet another ten minutes wait for our payment to be processed before being brought back to the table. In all, we waited nearly 30 minutes just to get our to-go deserts and check paid. My return from lunch is normally 1:30pm, today, it was 2:15. <br><br>Needless to say, I will never return to this location.

I am not a chain person and it&#39;s not often a chain gets 4 stars from me, however, we went here for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful evening experience. <br><br>The cheesecake is located inside the Dadeland mall, off of 88th towards the middle of the mall. <br><br>We had a group of ten and pretty much got seated right away. The waiter was friendly and very quick with drinks and food. <br><br>Our group sampled many items including the Mac and cheese hamburger (was ordered well and arrive a red medium) several pasta dishes and a kids pizza. Except for the mishap with the cooking of the burger, all were made to specifications (no cheese or extra bacon, etc). The pizza was surprisingly big for a kids meal. <br><br>We all know he stars of Cheesecake Factory is the cheesecake, and ours did not disappoint. White chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake is my favorite, but the Godiva and the Hershey chocolate bar cheesecakes were tasty as well.

I mean i usually love the cheese cake factory but this location has gone down hill, the hostess in front  seem lost and confused, once she sat us down the waitress took forever to come and at least offer us our drinks, our large party was rather irritated and wanted to get up and leave and all, once she finally came about 15 mins later we went ahead and ordered everything, the kids food took forever kids got there food last and ended up not eating there pizza because they were picking off our meals...i would probably skip this restaurant next time and drive the extra miles to dolphin mall location

To start off right, I came here because of a gift card to burn. When asked for a table, they sat us outside of the restaurant but inside of the mall (literally outside of the doors of the restaurant in a gated area less than 20 feet from a kiosk with crowds walking by). I asked to be moved and they accommodated me. <br><br>I ordered the steak that came with two sides, breaded green beans and mashed potatoes and requested that the mashed potatoes be subbed with roasted broccoli. The person with me got their food before me and the server brought out the steak 10 minutes later with the &#34;breaded side&#34;. We&#39;re talking 5 pieces of 1&#34; long green beans and a big empty space to the side. I waited another 10 minutes for the broccoli that looked like it was boiled and thrown in the oven with extra heat to make it roast quicker and was dry and tasteless on top and soggy and soft on the bottom. I asked the server to try another side and went with asparagus. <br><br>During this time, a manager came out and asked if we wanted them to take the steak back to keep warm while they prepared the asparagus. By this time, my friend had started his meal. When I asked about the side of green beans, he said that&#39;s exactly the portion they give and apologized for the empty space on the plate because since I &#34;asked for a substitution,&#34; they had to plate it separately. He was right. But why on Earth would you bring a half completed meal to the table? He acknowledged that was their mistake and offered me dessert to which I declined (damn you KetoDiet!).<br><br>Eventually the asparagus came out and I had started eating the steak and had finished my gerbil sized portion of green beans (by this point people around had arrived after us and left already). I commend the manager for trying to make it right but not for low key blaming the wait on my request for a substitution.

Went for Fourth of July with my<br>Cousin and his gf for a few slices of cheesecakes. Lol why not? We ordered  the Chris&#39;s outrageous, snickers and white chocolate macadamia nut. Chris outrageous was amazing as always white chocolate macadamia is a favorite of mine and the snickers didn&#39;t disappoint either. Then again  a lover of all things sugary. Will I be back? Of course this place always satisfies when a sugar craving hits.

It&#39;s not that I enjoy bad service, but sometimes I like to give certain places the benefit of the doubt, especially when there is potential. This Cheesecake Factory has potential, but the service here is absolutely awful. I can&#39;t even count how many times this place has let me down. <br><br>This past Sunday, I went with a group of friends. The hostess and one of the servers seemed to be feuding in front of us. What we received in terms of a welcome was far from warm. Speaking of warm, our food wasn&#39;t - everything was cold.... And speaking of cold... Our server&#39;s personality was cold, and about as stale as the potatoes that came with my breakfast. We didn&#39;t catch a single smile from him, nor did her even make an attempt to seem engaging. At a certain point (about 5 minutes in) we started feeling like he was annoyed with having to serve us. <br><br>If you&#39;re looking for mediocre food, crappy service, and an uncomfortable experience, this is your place. I&#39;m done giving them second (and 10th) chances.

I prefer this location over the one in Dolphin only because it&#39;s always extremely over crowded @ Dolphin Mall. I can come here 100 times and always have something different. This time I ordered the new Thai coconut chicken. Very flavorful. However, I think cheesecakes BEST dishes are definitely their pasta. Avocado egg rolls for appetizer are always a must have! Lastly, for dessert they now have pumpkin pecan cheesecake for fall and it is incredible. I wish I could have a slice every day during the fall season! Tons of yum!

Terrible food and terrible service!!!<br>Cheesecake Factories have turned into a mediocre restaurant.<br>My recent experience at Dadeland was terrible. Food arrived 2 hrs late. Neither of the managers cared to accommodate the customer after this bad experience.<br>Spend your hard earned $$$ elsewhere and where your business is appreciated. <br>No longer loyal to CF.

Always a safe bet for a fun atmosphere, decent food and drinks, and amazing cheesecakes. We came to pick up a whole cheesecake. They have most of the options available and our cheesecake was ready within 10 minutes of placing the order. They also gave us complementary whipped cream to go. We got the Godiva chocolate cheesecake and it was a hit with everyone! Super rich, dark chocolatey, and the perfect balance of sweet and bitter-- will satisfy any chocolate craving.

If your looking for a place wit cold food and terrible service and a place were the food takes over a hour and a half to come out then this is the place for you.... if it was possible for me to leave 0 Stars on this place I would

As you walk into the restaurant, it Greets you with a wide variety of cheesecakes on display. The menu has a wide variety of different foods from hamburgers to pasta. What we got as an appetizer was the avocado egg rolls. They were delicious! Our waiter on the other hand was very dry and rude. He didn&#39;t seem to like this job. The portions of food are huge. The hamburgers are great, the pasta da Vinci&#39;s really good, and the cheesecake is even better!! <br><br>We got the Oreo cheesecake and the White chocolate raspberry cheesecake (I believe that&#39;s what it was called) The cheesecakes really light and wonderful! When you order ask for extra whip cream!The whip cream there is great, it&#39;s so smooth, and great to put on your cheesecake! the Oreo cheese cake tasted more like chocolate , I was hoping for a more Oreo <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftaste.it&amp;s=3baa4595ba150370b46c5f34427d794a10997ef561436a7c34e302bec042e1dc" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">taste.it</a> looked as if they had taken the Oreo cheesecake and dipped in chocolate and then sprinkled Oreo crumbs over it. The chocolate overpowered The Oreo cheesecake. <br><br>The other cheesecake that we got, the white chocolate raspberry,was excellent. I don&#39;t like raspberries but this cheesecake change my opinion about it! Ha ha ha! The reason I&#39;m giving this place three stars is because our waiter was rude and it&#39;s kind of expensive. I mean, $54 for a whole cheesecake, I can buy one at Publix for $30. If your going to come here it&#39;s mostly going to be for the desserts.

I don&#39;t make a habit out of writing bad reviews but I feel that this one is necessary. My wife and I have dined here on numerous locations since we live close by and the food and service are usually good. The past few visits however have gotten worse it seems. The restaurant is not clean. The floor is dirty, the bathroom is dirty and yesterday we both came down with something after we left. My wife is not feeling well today and her symptoms point to a potential foodborne illness (I work in the public health sector). I would like to see management take some steps to improve the experience at this location since the menu and options are outstanding.

Everyone seems to love this place. Their consistency is directly related to how busy they are at the time of service. Less busy, more organized, crazy busy, a bit spotty. <br>The best feature of course is their ever changing and updated menu that challenges you you try something different on each visit, so that your new fav can soon become an old-fav!
Always packed but amazing place. Last time I went it took a little long to get the order but everything was delicious. wait time is usually not that long. its a big place. love it here!

This is by far the worst restaurant in this shopping center. They messed up my child&#39;s food 4 times.  I asked for a plain burger. The first time they put cheese. Next time they put lettuce. And similar mistakes the next two times. Then they literally gave me frozen food twice, and they gave my wife the wrong order 3 times. This was planned to be at most a 45 minute visit, but it took one hour and 45 minutes. Luckily they waived the price for the adult food, but not the two kids meals I got. I didn&#39;t even order dessert and the total was 35 dollars for two kids meals that were in very small portions. That&#39;s the three and a five. At the end my kids were starving, so we went in our beat up Toyota with our extremely sexy dog to Taco Bell and enjoyed a scrumptious meal their for 5.49. And that would be something I am willing to pay 35 dollars for.

I&#39;ve been coming here for over 15 years, always have had great service, delicious food and always on point. Lately it hasn&#39;t been that way. We celebrate almost every birthday in our family here so we know the menu pretty well. I always order the chicken Romano and the pasta comes out dry and a bit hard. I&#39;m use to the creamy well done pasta but not anymore! They&#39;ve changed the cook time?? Today topped it off... there was flies all over our area. I&#39;m not talking about 1,2,3,4,5,6 flies. I&#39;m talking about 15 plus flies hanging out and flying over our food trying to land and we were too busy swishing the flies away. I lost my appetite and considered sending a complaint to the manager but was there for my nephews graduation so decided to just pay and leave with a nasty taste. This location has lost there touch with the food. I will not be returning to cheesecake dadeland mall.

Don&#39;t order take out from here. They&#39;re 100% guaranteed to 1 lose your order, act like it was never placed, EVEN THOUGH YOU HAVE ALREADY PAID or 2. Give it to you 35 min later with most of the most important ingredients missing. The order takers and cooks need to get aligned with each other. Great restaurant. Terrible system, service, management.

I love it that anywhere you go you can always find a Cheesecake Factory and find your favorite meal. I knew the food was going to be quality, so when you get good service it just makes the experience that much better! Shannon was awesome! Witty, smart, and knew the menu inside and out to where she was able to decode what we wanted to find it on the menu for us. Of course I will be back, and of course I&#39;ll ask for Shannon!

We had a large group (about 16-19 persons) and the wait staff did a fantastic job.  The dishes we ordered was good.<br><br>The only downside was the wait to get seated.  It was a Friday night and extremely crowded

Took my daughter out to eat for her birthday. Big mistake coming here. I had the chicken peanut dish with rice and she had the angel hair pasta w shrimp. We had an average time with ok service. The food made us both very sick to our stomachs, I can imagine how dirty their kitchen is or whether they store/handle their food safely. The restrooms were very dirty and the floors of the restaurant were also dirty. Not coming back here again.
Amazing food, it was served pretty fast so no long waiting, also, the attention recieved was awesome, will go again with my husband for sure.

I have always loved the Cheesecake Factory, but the last three times I have been there I have noticed a steady decline in the service. The food is as good as always, but the service is getting worse by the day. Hope they fix it before people stop going. Would hate to lose this chain.

We went on a Friday night at about 9pm, we were a group of 5 with 1 child. We waiting about 15 or so minutes which we thought was amazing to begin with. The menu really is packed so I recommend maybe browsing the menu online before you come to decide what you more or less might want (most have pictures online). When we sat down, our server, Anthony, was amazingly attentive and such a joy to have visiting our table. He was very helpful when he realized half the table had never been here before and offered suggestions and ideas. We knew about portions but he reiterated again because we went crazy with appetizers and entrees. He was not kidding. <br><br>The food was both a hit and miss. Some of the food was good like the BangBang Shrimp, Guacamole Salad, and the Mac&amp;Cheese burger and our appetizers (spinach dip, nachos, and deliciously amazing fried calamari). But some were misses like the tostada salad which had both the chicken breast and the tostada that were burnt and some stuff was missing a touch of seasoning. The drinks we good (need more ojito variety though). <br><br>The cheesecake of course was amazing. No complaint whatsoever on the dessert menu. So overall if we could divide the rating it&#39;d be 5 for the server and ambience but 3ish for the overall good.

This is probably the most overrated restaurant in all of Miami... ok maybe not all of Miami but still. I had ordered Teriyaki Chicken for a main course and Fondue for an appetizer. To start things off my table was sticky and the menus were icky, the fondue I had ordered was terrib, and also you could tell is not completely fondue more like it was a mix of cheddar cheese that had the consistency of silly puddy. My teriyaki chicken did not taste NOTHING like teriyaki chicken and barely had any seasoning other than that it was decent at best, although they give a decent amount of food. The cheesecake- the main focus of the restaurant was mediocre I&#39;ve had better 7/10 for the cheese cake itself. Overall 2 Stars out of 5.

I have been to the Dadeland Cheesecake Factory many times. There is usually a wait, but you can just head into a few stores to kill a little time. Once your name is called, service is consistent and fast. They have one of those awesome menus that you could spend hours dwelling and agonizing over. Just don&#39;t (agonize) because everything is good, and you WILL go back, so can try whatever you were undecided about. The serving size is large, so I&#39;d warn you not to fill up on bread, but that&#39;s impossible. The hearty portions of crusty warm white bread and warm brown bread are irresistible. Although I&#39;ve tried many dishes, my favorite is actually a huge appetizer, the Thai Lettuce Wraps. Grilled Asian chicken with various toppings, such as matchstick carrots, noodles, cucumbers, fresh cilantro, and sprouts. You make your own and wrap them in lettuce, and dip them into one of three super delicious sauces. I have only had the cheesecake twice. But spend some time salivating at the amazing choices behind the huge glass counter displays. You can always take home a slice.
Im not sure if a lot of people order this but I definitely love the beets and goat cheese salad at this place. It&#39;s an interesting salad and I highly recommend it.
I always order the same thing a bunch of appetizer or the bacon bacon cheeseburger it&#39;s soooo good.

While visiting we decided to try The Cheesecake Factory, as this was our first time doing so. The food was good and service was great. We visited around 2 pm and the place did not seem too busy. Unsure of the crowds around lunch or dinner time.  This quickly became a favourite and we will be visiting again when back in Miami!

Had lunch here this past weekend with my aunt. The restaurant looks like any of their other locations, nicely decorated and packed of course. The restaurant was clean and orderly, and the service was good. Our waiter was very attentive. We started off with some cocktails, I ordered the mule, which was awful. A good mule should have a decent amount of ginger flavoring in it, whether it be ginger puree or ginger beer. This drink barely tasted like ginger at all. It tasted like tonic water with some seltzer. I then ordered the beet and goat cheese salad. It is located under the small plates, appetizers section, and boy is it small! The amount of goat cheese given was a joke, and the beets were cut up into tiny little cubes, very disappointing. As my main plate, I had the thai wraps. This was delicious. It is fresh lettuce leaves, cabbage leaves, grilled chicken, cilantro, carrots, bean sprouts, and 3 sauces. You build your own spring roll. Very light but filling. I loved it. The chicken was flavorful, and the peanut sauce and chili sauce were so yummy. I do not recommend ordering this though if on a date, because it is very messy lol.

Worst cheese factory in United States  . The sevice is not good and the food does not have flavor . They brought the food very late . I understand that this place is busy ,but should  we just get the sevice that is expected?

I went close to closing time and I felt bad because of waiter seemed rushed but halfway through our meal they relieved him and our new waiter was awesome! We were craving something sweet late night and we wanted to try something new so we looked through the menu and the lemon merengue looked awesome. <br><br>I loved it but the person I was with thought it was too sweet, I guess she was expecting something more tart flavor but nevertheless it was still good.<br><br>We also ordered a smoothing the tropical one with passion fruit even though the waiter said the best one on the menu was the mango one it was still delicious!

Great food, great service, great atmosphere.<br>Cheesecake factory never disappoints :)<br><br>This time I had the veggie burger - it was a bit too oily, but still great.<br>My waitress was very nice and kept on filling my glass with coke :)
Really good cheescakes but a little bit too big for me. <br>And some of the waiters aren&#39;t very nice !
Never disappointed, treated with care and awesome food. Usually get tamales cakes. Thanks !

I hate to give a bad review. But this trip deserves it.  I found the one item on the menu that is not a gut buster, their grilled salmon.<br><br>The best part of the meal was the steamed carrots. Salmon was so over cooked it changed color.  Tasted ok but I know why they serve it with tartar sauce.  &#34;Salad&#34; was about 20 pieces of fancy lettuce with a splash of dressing and it was served at same time as the hot food. Is this a Miami thing?<br><br>Start to finish was almost an hour. Took so long I didn&#39;t think cheesecake was worth another hour.

Do you want a 100 page menu and big portions? Then this place is for you. I was out with friends and we started out with a few appetizers. I think the thai chicken lettuce wraps were delicious and would recommend. The spring roll was very bland and just a wrapped salad. <br><br>I ordered the salmon which came with mashed potatoes and broccoli. The portion size wasn&#39;t that big compared to the rest of the menu which was great for me.  I wish they would have asked me how I like my salmon since it was very dry. Others at the table ordered steak, veggie burger, regular Kobe burger, etc. None of the meals stuck out besides the portion size. <br><br>Our table couldn&#39;t decide on dessert so we ordered a few different ones to share amongst the group. We had the Kailua and coffee  cheesecake, ice cream sundae, and chocolate cake. The cake was very rich and a bite or two is all you need. The cheesecake was the perfect combo and  lighter. <br><br>This place is very crowd and doesn&#39;t take reservations. With that please keep that in mind because the service will be slow
My food was completely burnt and my boyfriends was cold. Our server would disappear from time to time. It was hard to get a hold of her. <br>Never coming again.

This restaurant offers a wide variety of food options. This place is crowded almost every time we go and they do not take reservations. <br><br>The greatest entree I ever had here was the wasabi crusted ahi tuna. I was disappointed that they no longer have this on their menu.<br><br>They have great drinks and lots of cheesecakes to choose from so It can also be a great stop for just drinks and dessert.

The wait was awful! They sat a group before us with The same number of people who came after us. The server was ok. The food though is always good we just had to wait a while for the food also. I do recommend the hibachi steak.

I hope this was just an off day. I wasn&#39;t even sure who my waiter was. They made us wait a very long time to even get water. The food we ordered took a very very long time and in the end they didn&#39;t have my order ready with everyone else&#39;s. In fact, everyone&#39;s order came out at different times and mine took almost half an hour after everyone else&#39;s. With all the other delicious restaurants that have popped up in the mall you&#39;d think they&#39;d up their game. Nope. <br>My food was good, although my mother wasn&#39;t thrilled with her flatbread, and my father didn&#39;t much care for his chicken sandwich. Makes me sad because I have such fond memories of a better cheesecake restaurant many years back.

This review is for take out ordering ONLY!! Not for dining in which has always been a pleasant experience for me<br><br>Since I live close by I call in to order all the time but I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s their employees or their system of taking in orders that makes this place horrendous!!! I am not bashing their food because it is always great but below are two examples of MANY that I have experienced when ordering out from here. Once again... if I didn&#39;t live so close and if their food wasn&#39;t so good I would never order from here!<br><br>I called once and was put on hold for over 15 minutes...  I ended up hanging up, and called back and explained to the person who answered the phone what occurred only to be put on hold again. This was ridiculous so I got in my car and drove there (still on hold) there only to show the manager how long I&#39;ve STILL been on hold and requested to show a manager how I was still on hold and my call history of how I had been on hold 15 minutes even prior to the call I was on.  The place wasn&#39;t even busy that day. <br><br>Another time I ordered (again I had been on hold forever) and I went to pick up my meal.  When I arrived, I watched 2 employees stare at the phone ring and each look at each other and tell one another to answer it... they refused. A manager was walking around the pick up/order area and heard the phone ringing and asked one of the two aforementioned employees, &#34;do you hear the phone? Are you going to answer it?&#34; They employee responded that he didn&#39;t hear the phone and proceeded to roll his eyes and answer it! This pissed me off because I am the guy that&#39;s always on hold FOREVER because of situations like that so I pulled the manager aside and told him everything I observed.  Don&#39;t know what happened after I left but he was appreciative that I brought it to his attention!<br><br>Cheesecake Dadeland really needs to do something about this!

Tonight I am actually giving this place one star. The service was slow to start and then to wait over an hour for our food to come and some of the dishes were ice cold. We asked our waiter to get the manager and before he walked away , he said they had several people call in sick and the kitchen is really backed up. The manager came over and did not apologize about the wait. He said it is taking 25 minutes to get food  out of the kitchen. Our response was well that&#39;s fine but we ordered our food over an hour ago. Again no apology, nothing. This was real sad., so that&#39;s the reason for one star.
Shitty service as usual. 45+ mins for apps. Drinks made without garnishes. Server standing around talking to the bar tenders instead of getting waters or bread. So over this place.

Can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake factory! Literally a bible of food. I never make it through the whole menu but I always try something different and yet to have a bad meal! Can&#39;t even get me started on their cheesecake list, I always eat one there and take one because I have to savor every bite! <br><br>Jorge R. Has been my server many times and he is always on point with recommendations because I never know what I may want to try next!

So yesterday was national cheesecake day and I made a point to visit Cheesecake Factory since they had 50% off every cheesecake. Sounds great right? I self sat in the bar lounge area with no wait. The lobby was beyond backed so luckily the bar tables were available. I ordered the celebration cheesecake since I kept seeing it all over social media. Gotta say it was the first time I did not like a cheesecake from this place. It tasted like boxed cake and very artificial. I basically left it and nibbled at my sisters salted caramel cheesecake which was phenomenal.

I went to Cheesecake on Sunday <br>And was served by Daniella <br>I went with a friend to unwind have a couple of glasses of wine and eat some dinner <br>She was amazing <br>She stop by our table and was very attentive but not that annoying type <br>I&#39;m definitely going back soon and getting sat in her section <br>Definitely a delight having her as my server

Doing some shopping so decided to have lunch w the fam, ordered from their small plates menu and it was just perfect. The only thing is that the did not have any high chair available for the kids, kind of weird that there was none available. I love this restaurant but not a fan of cheesecakes, ai always ask for the black out cake, it is amazing.

My daughters and I went here for a Mothers Day lunch. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad, but it was also 11am. It seemed to be getting crazy when we were leaving. We had the Honey Truffle Chicken and it was AMAZING. All 3 of us shared it and still had leftovers, that&#39;s how huge this thing was. One of the best batters I&#39;ve ever had. The service was fantastic. And I know sometimes servers get frustrated when one of their 3 tables ends up not ordering a lot....usually means less tip. But you wouldn&#39;t have known, she was so attentive and nice. She got a 40% tip for not making me feel cheap  (really I just didn&#39;t want to carry around leftovers) It was an overall great experience

Perfect family restaurant!  So much in the menu.  Everytime we come I have had something different.  The best is to order and share bunch of different apps and top off with some cheesecake or better yet some Lemoncello!?  Best cake....

I always visit. Today was just horrible , we ask for chicken wings as appetizer and it was fried with old oil and over cooked, than today is the first time I tried the Carne Asada medallion dish and the rice was cold, the meat was over cooked and dry. Super dry plate. Very disappointed. The manager always comes over and offers an apologies or is there something else they can get for you for the inconvenience this time nothing the customer service was horrible. At least the waitress was super nice and attentive.

Came in to Cheesecake Factory for early lunch since we needed to do some shopping at Dadeland.  I was in the mood for some pancakes, and I really like the ones from here so I ordered the brunch combo which bring 2 pancakes , 2 eggs, and bacon .  I added a side of breakfast potatoes .  The pancakes were just as good as I remember, and they come with a really good syrup.  The eggs were fine, it&#39;s hard to mess up scrambled , but the bacon wasn&#39;t.  The bacon was cooked, but the texture wasn&#39;t from fried bacon, the texture when I ate it was as if it was microwaved.  My wife ordered The fried macaroni and cheese balls.  She said they were very good, as was her margarita.  My wife ordered for desert a pumpkin cheesecake.  It took so long to bring the cheesecake that she just ended up getting it to go.  I definitely think it took that long because our waiter just took long for everything .  The service was definitely sub par today.  (My wife did say the cheesecake was good when she eventually had it.)

Can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory! Their menu is so extensive and they have a little bit of everything to satisfy everyone&#39;s cravings. If you&#39;re craving Italian, American, Japanese , almost anything  they have some of each cuisine which is what makes this place so great in my opinion and no to add it all taste amazing too ! Everything from a burger , to a salad to their pasta are all so good my favorite appetizers however are the avocado egg rolls and the corn tamale cakes , both so so so good !! I love the chicken Romano and he orange chicken from there as well ! Ofcourse can&#39;t brag enough about their brown bread , it&#39;s the best and they bring you as much as you want , even to take home if you want some, all you have to do is ask! Service is alway awesome when I go too , and after they opened up the patio area and extended the outside for more seating the wait is no wher near as long anymore , actually haven&#39;t had to wait the last few times I&#39;ve gone . And being that my favorite dessert is cheesecake I can&#39;t pick a favorite because they are all amazing , but snickers , pumpkin and Oreo one are top 3 !

You can never go wrong coming to Cheesecake factory.  Their menu is huge and there&#39;s so much variety even a vegetarian would have trouble trying to pick something out. The complimentary sweet brown bread (I want to say it&#39;s pumpernickel but I&#39;m honestly not sure, not really a bread person) is just so warm and delish with butter that begins to melt as soon as you spread it. Omg that bread is so damn good but watch it, you can get sucked in and ruin a bit of your appetite because you can&#39;t seem to stop eating it ( it&#39;s happened to me plenty of times). I came here on a Saturday night with my parents so be prepared, the place was packed. We chose to skip the wait and found a tall table top in the bar area. I wish I remembered our waitresses name because she was dynamite!!! But she was quick, helpful, and just a sweetheart all together. I asked her a million questions about different menu items because of course anxiety kicked in and I wanted everything. She helped me make the best decision and we were all satisfied with our meals and  our bottle of red. I must say out of our three meals my stepfather had the best miso salmon I&#39;ve ever tasted, I must come back and order it, it was really good. If you plan on coming here over the weekend try and come early or be prepared for a wait but trust me, the wait is worth it!

I honestly think Cheesecake is an appetizer and dessert kind of place.<br><br>To me, the appetizers sound much more tastier than the main meals, and I&#39;ve never been disappointed by them. Try the avocado rolls or the lettuce wraps. Plus, order a few and it will fill you up leaving room for dessert! And who can come to Cheesecake without getting cheesecake?!  There are so many to choose from, and they are all delicious!<br><br>Just forget the main dish, it nothing to brag about. Although I must say that their mashed potatoes are good. This past time I went, I was not impressed by the meal, Chicken Madeira. I know it&#39;s one of their most popular selling dishes, but it just didn&#39;t do it for me. Just keep in mind that their portion sizes are HUGE! You can easily share a meal, or keep half for tomorrows lunch. <br><br>As far as service is concerned, this place is always busy, and you will always wait for a table. I don&#39;t mind eating indoors or on their outdoor patio, and that sometimes speeds up the wait time. On the downside, the last time I was here, the server and other staff were unprofessional about their coworkers and their responsibilities. Maybe they were comfortable serving our table, and therefore let their work-guard down, but it left a sour taste in my experience here.

A great restaurant. We did not have a reservation and were seated in less then 10 minutes. The food was excellent and our server was very friendly. She recommended some appetizers that were really good. Will be back!
Arrived @ table 5:50 no service till 6:01 so denied happy hour menu prices by server &amp; manager because of their slow server.

If you request modifications to your meal, check when the food arrives that they followed your simple instructions. They tried to offer me a salad for my trouble. Yeah cause that&#39;s what I want, a freaking salad when I ordered a burger that they couldn&#39;t remember to take off the onions. Glad I only ate a quarter of it and noticed. They took it off the bill as I was so irritated as I have not eaten all day and the only thing I ordered came screwed up. <br><br>I&#39;m not allergic, thank God. But I can&#39;t help but worry for my friends who do have allergies. <br><br>At least they didn&#39;t screw up my boyfriend&#39;s food and the waiter was nice. It was the kitchen that screwed up. Proceed with caution, especially if you have allergies.

Love their menu!!!!!!!They have a little or everything and are willing to accommodate your order in chases changes can apply. Turkey burger, spicy cashew chicken, fried mac and cheese, corn tamales, thai lettuce wrap are amazing!!! I can keep on going. Oreo and the salted caramel cheesecake are to die for. Recommend for big and small parties. They have lots of variety!!

Great experience.<br><br>Service:<br>Amazing server nothing wrong and very kind and welcoming.<br><br>Food. Amazing I really enjoyed it.<br>Ambience.<br>Amazing and I liked the way they celebrated a costumer birthday.<br><br>After all amazing experience I ll be back if I ever ll be hungry in that area.<br>Thanks.

Went here for dinner and was totally surprised. Ordered grilled salmon with asparagus and mashed potatoes. It was all gluten free and was a perfect meal. The salmon was so moist and delicious. It was perfectly cooked it even had grill marks on it that added to the flavor. The potatoes were hot and well cooked and so was the asparagus. The salmon was very tasty without being overly salty. It was obvious that they have an experienced chef in the kitchen. They give you very generous portions. Other people with me had the herb encrusted salmon and also loved it.  We also ordered cheesecake for dessert. They now offer two gluten free options for cheesecake. They used to only have the Godiva chocolate cheesecake and have also added  a coffee chocolate cheesecake and it was light and delicious.  I will definitely go back to Cheesecake Factory.

I love this place which is why I am giving it three stars, buuuuuut, I did go there today wanting to sit at the bar have a drink and enjoy my Mac n cheese balls and when I would be ready I&#39;d order my miso salmon. Didn&#39;t happen like that. Twice i had to send back my Mac n Cheese balls because they were bone cold. I say twice because I really wanted them, so I had asked for them to be ordered again. The second time they came around they were still cold. I was very disappointed. A manager came around the first time letting me know the app would be comped. When the second disappointment came he came back and just said sorry man. I said it&#39;s okay, I&#39;m a happy go luck kind of person so I didn&#39;t get mad. I was disappointed but not mad, on to the main course then. My miso salmon. Suffice it to say it came out hot but about 20 min after my second failed attempt at the app came out. I paid for my meal. $45 and some change. Its not about the money. But after the disappointing app (2 times none the less) my main course should have came  within 15 min. It didn&#39;t. It took a little more than 20 min. The guests next to me asked me about my dilemma and agreed with me that it should not have taken that long and that my main course should have been comped since I didn&#39;t get anything comped. The Mac n cheese got returned twice. I didn&#39;t get to enjoy that. So I obviously shouldn&#39;t pay for something I didn&#39;t enjoy. What they should have comped is my $16 miso salmon. Why lose a guest over a $16 plate of food? Idk. But they just lost me and I&#39;ve been coming here since I was 18, I&#39;m 28 now. Do the math how on  how much I&#39;ve possibly spent. Now compare that to how much a $16 plate actually costs them. Less than $7. They lost a customer over a $7 plate. Asides from all that the bartenders George and Andrew were amazing. They did make my disappointment much better.

If there&#39;s no wait I don&#39;t mind either here (that&#39;s why the 4 stars), the food here is always consistent- always good! With a lunch portion salad you will be more than good or the yummy Thai lettuce wraps, those two items are my go to! Service is very good here and I&#39;ve found that when they tell you 15 minutes, it&#39;s 15 minutes not 30 like most mall restaurants tell you! <br>You can never go wrong with any of their cheesecakes but I always love to ask the waiter there favorite and decide from there! <br>There&#39;s also great coffee here

Haven&#39;t been here in 10 years , this time around , I can honestly say that this time around , everything was delicious , not so much of a pasta person , so went with the herb salmon , it was so delicious and full of flavors .<br>Staff was friendly and there was no wait which was a plus ! <br><br>Will be returning here

I come here from time to time. Serves varies depending on the server. We went close to closing and our server was fantastic. Very friendly and attentive and assured us we could spend our dinner night with no rush. Everything I have had is big portions and delicious. Even if sometimes the serves is not there. Definitely recommend.
Very disapointment. The food is good but when I saw  1 cockroach  walking for the wall near to my table It was really a bad time. I never come back to this place.

jennifer L sure aint been there recently so if I were you I would pass on this store in dadeland mall---u could not ask for a better mall or location but over the years this store has dropped in popularity with me and many pals that used to go weekely; no more; for instance we order a turkey burger carrots and a shrimp salad and thats it no wines no apps...and it takes 49 minutes to get food and thats with a cold burger and carrots that clearly had been way over their safe eating date as they were putrid and inedible; so broccoli was replaced well after I finished dinner and a cup of coffee... far too many choices than to drop 44 dollars and a tip here and with the millions this brand makes there and elsewhere, just no no excuse for charging for substandard and unsafe food/

Sunday evening, restaurant not that full yet waited over 45 minutes for my food and sides after sitting down. <br><br>Either hire more employees or cooks or a present manager to interact with customers and make sure their satisfied.

The service was good but the dishes and wait time was really bad. THEY NEED TO DO A BETTER JOB OF CLEANING ! Tables were dirty and spoons and forks and knifes where just really dirty man. It&#39;s not that hard to clean them correctly.

Started off with a strawberry lemonade, which was freshly made. You can even see the strawberry seeds in it! Since I dined with a group of 7, we devoured the bread in a few seconds! But the server brought us more brown bread within seconds, which was fresh and warm. I ordered a spicy chipotle chicken pasta to share with my sister, the portion was HUGE! Which I&#39;m happy for because it makes the price worth it. The pasta was thrown in a creamy redish sauce, hence the the &#34;spicy&#34; part, and tortilla chips were added in for a crunchy kick, which was enjoyable. It was yummy, but not as yummy as the regular chipotle pasta they used to have. I guess they took it off the menu unfortunately, still a pleasant  entree though!<br>To end the meal, we ordered a tiramisu cheesecake. I absolutely love the way they fused tiramisu cake with cheesecake, with the powdered top, bottom tiramisu cake texture, and cheesecake middle. It was light, the chocolate whip cream on top wasn&#39;t too heavy but a fluffy cream. Perfection. Definitely try this cheesecake and their flavored lemonades!

Say it isn&#39;t so...1 hr ticket time, completely forgotten orders, incorrect items, lack of appreciation on server&#39;s/management&#39;s part as it concerns the complete downward spiral of an experience, manager had nothing more to say than &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34; when I expressed our disappointing experience (and he struggled with that), consistent and continuous disorganization throughout the entire experience, and it just continued to the bitter end.<br><br>This is particularly sad considering I am a huge fan, and the one to speak highly of a chain that is generally consistent a B+, which is more than many in the restaurant business can say. That said, I&#39;m hoping that this was just their &#34;bad day,&#34; and not the beginning of an unfortunate trend. We shall see.<br><br>(Tip to Management: Time for Servers and Managers to get a review on some Customer Service 101.)

While I hadn&#39;t been to any of the Cheesecake Factory locations in at least 4 years prior to coming here, I&#39;d normally had good experiences at their restaurants.  On this day, the service was sorely lacking, however.<br><br>I came here with a friend on a recent Sunday at around 12:30 for brunch.  We were seated at a table for 2 in front of the place (in other words, in the cordoned off area that juts out into one of the main interior corridors here at Dadeland Mall), and we were then basically neglected for the remainder of our time here.  We placed our orders and we noticed that nearby tables who&#39;d ordered after us received their food several minutes before we did.  The glass of water I ordered with my beverage never came until I asked for it again when our food was finally delivered.  Once we were done with our meals, we sat there for quite a few minutes with no one checking on us before I finally asked one of the other servers for the check.
