After the check was delivered and we placed our cards inside the pouch, again, it was quite some time before she finally returned to take our payment.   We noted that most of the tables around us had one particular waiter, and our waitress was kind of the &#34;odd man out&#34; in our section, so I&#39;m unsure if we got there before the other guy started his shift, or if she had several tables to tend to inside and was only taking care of us when she remembered to come out front to check on us, or what the situation was.<br><br>Aside from the poor service, our meals were fine - the potatoes I&#39;d ordered were quite good and my omelet was so large I could barely finish it (this isn&#39;t surprising, considering The Cheesecake Factory is known for their gigantic portions).  If the service would&#39;ve been better, they&#39;d have probably received another star.  Total for his breakfast sandwich, my omelet, a glass of milk and a glass of OJ came to $31.43 before gratuity.

Hi, the waiter didn&#39;t ask why our plates were barely halfway finished. I asked for two drinks to save time. I actually had to ask a passing waiter to get a refill. It didn&#39;t even seem that busy considering multiple tables were open around us during lunch. I have been here before, albeit a couple years ago, and wanted to give it another shot as last time the food (normal) didn&#39;t justify the cost/experience. It&#39;ll be my wife&#39;s choice if we go back. You should really consider including a first responder, officer, firefighter, and military discount.

I&#39;ve been to this location quite a bit over the last few years, and the food is always as expected at any other Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s nice to have consistency with the most important part of the experience. The only thing is the waiters/waitresses are always missing when you need them the most. They&#39;ll visit multiple times while eating your food to check in with you, but as soon as it comes time to get the check you&#39;ll be waiting quite a while. Overall, consistently good good but with an inconsistent staff.

When I first arrived the setting seem kind of lazy, the plates and the folks, and knives were laying out there on the table, and of course they looked kind of dirty. Not dirty as in filth but dirty as in it looks like when they washed them they let the water sit on the silverware and you could see the water stains. In all the other places I went to they had the silverware wrapped before giving it to you and never let a plate sit out in the open like that.<br><br>We had the crab bites-- It was so good it was gone in 1 minute. <br><br>My dad had a huggeee bowl of chicken and shirmp gumbo with rice, it cost like 17 dollars so I was hoping the bowl would be huge. He said it was good.<br><br>I had fried catfish, mashpotatoes, and a tiny bit of green beans... That catfish was the best catfish I have ever tasted, it was SO buttery and soft. The only downside is that it was not enough, but I paid like 18 dollars for that so it should have been at least two pieces.<br><br>I also had the nutella cheesecake to go, it tasted pretty good.. But I think the traditional taste better.

My daughter and I were shopping and she wanted to come here. I was in the mood for a nice salad so I was ok with it. I have always enjoyed how large their menu is especially when you have no idea what your in the mood for. This menu helps satisfy any craving. <br><br>From the moment we sat our server took our drink order ASAP. He was rushing us for some reason. I was not digging his energy or attitude at all. <br><br>After finding a salad that seemed like a great choice I ordered the Carlton Salad. The menu stated balsamic dressing. I asked the server for extra dressing.  We ordered stuffed mushrooms to start and they were delightful.  The server had brought over a small cup of the dressing. <br><br>Immediately I was like oh that color, texture does not look good. I dipped my fork in it and ugh it was awful. Creamy texture with a robust taste of peanuts and sweet.  I&#39;m like WTH. Minutes has passed when I called our server over to the table. I first asked if possible he gave me the wrong dressing. He said no that&#39;s the balsamic. I asked if he could make sure the dressing was not poured on my salad and I would choose another. He rudely said well I&#39;m sure your salad is done so nothing I can do. Mind you this is after I told him how awful it was. <br><br>Ok long story short my salad came out with the awful dressing on it. I asked for another dressing to pour on top to try and mask the flavor. The salad was fresh, it would have been perfect if not for the peanut dressing, <br><br>When a manager came over she said yes that&#39;s the right dressing. I explained to her either they should specify peanut dressing on the menu or explain what it taste like to guest if they order it. Luckily I don&#39;t have a peanut allergy otherwise I would be dead. <br><br>This just really put a bad taste in my mouth how they handled it. She did say if I disliked it she would replace it with another salad. Well my daughters food was out and I did not want to wait for another salad. <br><br>For me this was a case of really bad word choices on the menu. Obviously this chain does not care about Customer Service. <br><br>Blah, pass on this place!

I went here on a Friday for my birthday celebration and to sum it all up- it was an awesome experience. I read previous reviews and expected a long wait especially with the weekend rush, but surprisingly I got lucky and was seated almost immediately. Our waiter, David, was so friendly and patient with us throughout the evening. I ordered the Classic Burger with a side of fries (it was sooo good).<br><br>My hunger was already satisfied (I stuffed my face with bread before the meal), but what&#39;s a birthday dinner without dessert? I have a peanut allergy so I&#39;m thankful David informed us that every cheesecake has a trace of peanuts. Therefore, I decided to get a slice of Linda&#39;s Fudge cake. They decorated a birthday plate for me and sang happy birthday. I need to describe this delicious slice so you understand the awesomeness: chocolate chip frosting with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and sprinkles on the side. Need I say more? Overall, it was a great night and thanks again to David for a fun and chill birthday dinner.

This place is always full but you wait just a few minutes and they will find a table for you and your group! The good is the best!!!! Any plate you order will be delicious! The amount of food is good enough! I love eating here on the weekend with my family! When it&#39;s the time to chose a cheesecake for desert it becomes a hard time because they all are amazing!!! Recommended 100% it will be with it every penny !

My most recent visit to &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; was Truly disappointing. On Mother&#39;s day this year my family decided we wanted to enjoy time together at home, so we ended up ordering take out at one of our favorite places to dine at. After waiting almost an hour for the food to be ready, I waited another 30 mins inside the restaurant to receive my complete order. I had to check the order 3 times, before they got everything correct. We had a long order which included: 3 orange chicken entrees, 1 lasagna, 1 chicken Alfredo Pasta, 3 kids Mac &amp; cheese, and 3 slices of cheesecakes. The quality of the food was horrible. The orange chicken was very Dry and did not taste as it usually does. The brown rice was not even well cooked &amp; the veggies were soggy and disgusting. The sweet potato fries were cold &amp; soggy as well. The pasta barely had any protein (chicken).The only good thing was our cheesecake, and I mean they can&#39;t have possibly messed up that part...I also asked for bread and they did not give it to me. I am very disappointed that my family couldn&#39;t enjoy a good Mother&#39;s Day dinner at home. I will definitely not be coming back here, after such a terrible experience. Definitely need many improvements done. Doesn&#39;t matter how busy a restaurant is the quality of service &amp; food shouldn&#39;t decrease to the level it did.
The woman&#39;s bathroom was filthy and handicapped bar was hanging out of wall<br>Otherwise food and service in restaurant was good
I love Cheesecake Factory! Always has great drinks and food... the noise level is pretty high and service isn&#39;t always reliable but overall you&#39;re tummy will be happy here.

Food cold and service very slow. I will think twice before returning. Don&#39;t sit at the table outside in the mall. They forget about you. Too bad they turned a nice Friday night into a frustrating evening.

I love Cheesecake Factory I come eat here all the time. But today has been one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve ever had in any Cheesecake. We sat at a high top and the server walked by us a good 4 to 6 times and ignored us. Literally walked to every other table but ours. We finally got up and got the attention of the manager Jesus and told him that we went 10-15mins with no drinks or service we had to get up and get our own menus. He could have cared less, but he did tell the waitress to go to us. She then came up and said&#34;are you ready to order&#34;, at this time my father got up and ask to be seated somewhere else. We were finally moved placed at the back table by the kitchen. Our new waitress was great no complaints on her. However the manager made no attempts to even ask us if everything was fine and kept walking by us. I come here at least once a month, guess I will stop and begin going to dolphin mall.<br><br>Raul and family

What a great morning. We went for a family birthday with 16 adults and teens. George Leonard served us and was outstanding. All the food was excellent, from the French toast, shrimp platter, teriyaki chicken to the hamburgers, tamales, bistro shrimp pasta to the breakfast burrito etc. Lots of great choices. We were able to sit at a long table there was no waiting at 10:30am. Granted the food took about 20 min or so but well worth it. George L. brought us more bread and drinks.  George L. needs to be a trainer on good customer service.  Don&#39;t let the bad reviews stop you. It was truly good.

Worst place I&#39;ve  ever visited,  Service was great I&#39;m not going to throw the waitress under the bus because she did her best. It was my daughters birthday and she decided to come to this place; Beverages came on time but we had to wait 50 minutes for the food, my Pasta was dry and crusty of been sitting under the heating lamp and the fries stale !!!! <br>No more business with this guy.

Food is always good,  but portions are smaller and price is still as high. It&#39;s become pricey!  Our server though,  Jesus B,  was awesome!  Skinny sangria was ok,  super expensive!  Prices are challenging because I haven&#39;t seen the restaurant full.

As a true Miamian, I understand parking anywhere is a bit hectic . I went on a Monday night and although it was packed I was able to find parking at the front of the mall where cheesecake factory is located. <br><br>When you walk in you are greeted automatically by the host . The atmosphere is vivacious but also romantic since they tend to dim the lights at night . <br><br>My server seemed very busy from the start and rushed . I understand it&#39;s a fast paced industry but you must always give undivided attention . Aside from that , his service was great !<br><br>For an appetizer , I had amazing crab wontons and they bring a good portion definitely enough for two people. As my main entrée I ordered the veggie burger ... it was DELICIOUS . Alcoholic drinks are made strong or maybe it was because I had cognac on the rocks... :) <br><br>This place is a must try !

The manager Jesus at this place was very rude. I came with my service dog and he did not let me sit inside. I had originally asked to be sit outside but they had no availability. Once they were able to arrange our sitting to outside because he didn&#39;t want my dog inside he has the audacity to ask for proof of service dog. THIS IS ILLEGAL!!!!! I showed him proof and kept arguing with me because he wanted me to leave. Very rude and disrespectful! They need a new manager ASAP!!!

This restaurant has been on my goto list for many years because of quality food served consistently, but all good things must come to an end. Slowly food quality and presentation have declined. Visited yesterday and crowds are still there, but not as bad as expected. They still have the fastest table turn over rate and was seated promptly. The food was mediocre to average. Ordered the onion rings which I&#39;ve never had and will never again. They  came in a horrible batter badly fried and greasy. They didn&#39;t come with any dipping sauce to redeem them. Ordered my favorite Chicken Madeira which never disappoints, but today it was awful. Came with a red sauce which I have never seen. Like it was suppose to be something else and they &#34;fixed&#34; it.  <br><br>The Shrimp Scampi Bistro was Average, although the shrimp quality is not there anymore. <br><br>Skipped dessert which still looks good. <br><br>During the long wait for my meal which would usually automatically trigger a manager visit, I noticed a little fruit fly hanging out. I thought it was odd, but that just might be a reflection of the restaurants cleanliness. <br><br>This place went from &#34;oh boy going to Cheesecake&#34; to another chain restaurant that is losing its way.

Visited in April 2016. <br><br>I went here a while ago with a coworker while we were training together. I was not in a good mood going into the restaurant (Miami has a tendency to do that) so I may be a bit biased and jaded in this review. I have been to the CF in Pembroke and have always been pleased. <br><br>The service here needs significant help. We pulled up to the bar, and it was hard for the tender to provide any service. I guess she was busy supplying the whole restaurant with drinks so she was unable to take care of us. Our drinks, water and alcoholic, remained empty for the duration of the night. The food was solid, as it mostly is, but the service needs help. <br><br>Parking is an absolute joke. It looks like this &#34;mall&#34; was built in 1920 when only 10% of the population had access to a motor vehicle. There is no parking anywhere and if you find a spot, consider yourself lucky. We arrived at 5:30 pm and the only available spots were occupied by the racket known as &#34;valet parking&#34;. Makes me sick. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t waste my time with a visit here or any other restaurant in this shopping complex due to parking and overall inconvenience.

Normally a good bet but not this time.  We were seated right away but it took over 10 minutes before somebody came to take our order.  He explained he was not our server.<br><br>Our appetizer came 10 minutes later.  Drinks cane 10 minutes after that.  Entrees came 30 minutes after we sat with no refills of water or explanation as to the subpar service.<br><br>The food was ok, not like at other times.  I overheard the location was under new management or ownership.  I did not confirm that.  Hopefully next time it will be better.

Just WOW! It is amazing the HORRIBLE service we&#39;ve encountered here today! BAD,BAD,BAD!!<br>Waiter, in lah, lah, land! <br>I am a local coming to this place for a long time, since Dadeland mall has grown and hence Cheesecake Factory has gotten busier the service and portions have DECREASED! <br>I had the shrimp sandwich! It is  stated on the menu as &#34;lots of shrimp&#34;! Huh!! What!? Are you kidding me? <br>Literally (5) small shrimps in the whole sandwich?<br>PLEASE DO NOT MISLEAD consumers, say it like it is! If it doesn&#39;t come with lots, then say so! That&#39;s all. Last time for me! That&#39;s for sure!

What a complete disappointment!! Waited 5 minutes for a table, an hour and a half for our food and to top it off, I told 2 people that it was my twins birthday and watched them tell the server and she forgot.  Great job guys

I dined here, last night on a busy Saturday night, and surprisingly the wait was only 20 minutes. After 20 minutes I was immediately seated and greeted by my waiter Jason. Jason was very kind, pleasant, and very attentive! My daughter wanted shrimp as an entrée so I got her the dynamite shrimp, I never knew that Cheesecake Factory had a kids menu until last night (which has a variety of items to choose from) except for shrimp, which was ok. I had The Tex Mex eggrolls, which came with the salsa and sauce, it was so fresh and crispy that it tasted as if Jason had deep fried the eggrolls right in front of me! I also had the chicken Madeira, steak Dianne and mash potatoes, it was good as expected no complaints other than I wished it came with more four pieces of steak. As you can see I didn&#39;t have room for dessert, but the cheesecakes are a &#34;must have&#34;. This restaurant never disappoints, the food is always fresh, the staff is always nice, and not too mention it&#39;s not expensive and they have a very large variety of food menu items to choose from.
Very good brunch green chilaquiles &amp; the sweet corn Tamales very good I recommend these two for brunch
Always busy, but good food as cheesecake never disappoints.. just takes super long when you order to go. As a mall employee it makes it so hard to order food here

The fettuccine Alfredo is a complete waste of money. Has no flavor, WHATSOEVER! Literally took 2 bites and the waitress came and said do you want a box? I said no I won&#39;t eat it! And she took it away and nothing else was said. Owell never will be back there again!

The Cheesecake Factory is a go to restaurant for me. They are open late, which is great when my boyfriend and I are looking for places to eat after we see a late movie. My favorite dish is the harvest chicken salad.

This is a go to restaurant of mine. The food is great, the service is great, the prices are great, the menu is enormous so I can either go with one of my favorite dishes or I could change it up a little. Large restaurant with great seating. The waiters/waitresses always make you feel welcome and there is something for everyone to enjoy. From Asian to Italian, there is nothing not not on the menu!<br><br>My favorite dish here are the Thai lettuce wraps. It&#39;s a little taco bar at your fingertips. Juicy warm chicken and lettuce and phenomena sauces to choose from. A, sweet, thick peanut sauce, a spicy, sweet Asian sauce, and a zesty cilantro sauce. I also really enjoy the tuna tartare and the orange chicken.<br><br>At the end of the day, this retardant never fails to satisfy! I would highly recommend!

Yeah... I had to be pursuaded to go back.<br>Not a huge fan of this place.<br>They are all the same and just can&#39;t seem to get it right.<br>The food was bland and needed seasoning.<br>Our server would disappear.<br>Just not a happy visit.
Dinner date with my daughter and we have the best waitress I&#39;ve ever had here, Jessica !! She has made this feel like a 5 star gourmet restaurant..

I use to love coming here!! But after much deliberation and several visits this year, i have come to the conclusion that I&#39;m gonna give the cheesecake a big break!! Lately every time I&#39;ve been there the experience is the same...dirty floors, nasty restrooms, dirty or stained plates, glassware, utensils and napkins, sometimes the service is good sometimes its terrible, and most important the food has gone down the drain, what use to be delicious and gourmet, now sucks!!! greasy and poor quality ingredients, prepared cafeteria style, yuck... the only good thing they still have is the cheesecakes...that from now on if i crave them, i will order it to go, because they ain&#39;t gonna see my pretty face there in a long while!
fried macaroni n cheese is ok the chicken littles is huge enough for two people, but i always feel like the place is dirty with the sluppery floors and nasty silverware right on the table

I love coming here. Everything is amazing from their delicious breads to the legendary cheesecakes. Their salads are also great and have an enormous portion. <br><br>This place is great for a group lunch or a company lunch. It&#39;s also a great happy hour to dinner place. Five stars all the way!
several empty tables and make us wait for 30 minutes for a table. Bureaucracy unnecessary Good food and terrible service!
Terrible, will not be back , avoid!!  Sunday morning , not even busy, took 15 minutes to get coffee. Food mediocre and service even worse. <br>Avoid at all costs and manager is clueless.

Food is usually very good and the service is OK. I had lunch there today and noticed that their suggested tip located at the bottom of the receipt is calculated including the tax. This is the only restaurant that does this. We eat out a lot and no other restaurant has done this. Shame on you.

NEVER get take out, it will take you longer to pick up your food than if you were just to eat it there. I got chicken Little&#39;s Togo and asked for extra bbq sauce. What did i get? No sauces at all. I also asked for bread and it took long as shit and they didn&#39;t give me any butter. Horrible horrible horrible !

This place has the best meatloaf I have ever had in a restaurant. It has lovely little bits of vegetables mixed in with the ground beef. The seasoning is perfect. It comes out a little toasted on the edges with a crispy caramelized top with a tomato based sauce on that top then they cover it with a brown mushroom gravy. The mashed potatoes are so home made that they ga e a few whole chunks of potato in them. The corn and veggies on the side are perfect fly cooked and seasoned.<br>The server was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is inviting and celebratory.

Andrew you make a nice drink now pour the whole thing , Terrie you have been fantastic you steered us in the right direction all your food recommendations have been on point fantastic meals . You are a treasure .thank you so very much .

If there is one Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ll always come to its this one in dadeland. It never fails to have a staff that goes above and beyond to serve the public and I see the potential here. Especially with my last server Jessica who was so wonderful and pleasant. I actually enjoyed my time here because of her and servers like Akeem and Alex who sadly just left the restaurant. Servers like these always make me want to come back again and again. Thank you for being so wonderful and your staff is full of winners! Your cheesecake is phenomenal and I cannot wait to come back. Great job guys!
The best veggie burger I ever had. The strawberry cheesecake was delicious as well. It has a very family kinda atmosphere so that&#39;s great. The prices are kinda high though....

Gave one star and that was to much I had the worst experience tonight , we had no appetizers ordered right away but yet my food took almost an hour to get my husband and I both ordered burgers and I wanted my burger really well done so he said that&#39;s why it was taking so long then I said go ahead and bring the other food and when he came with the food my burger is the one that came and my husband&#39;s didn&#39;t so when it got to the table had no fries and it was really burnt and the inside was  extremely raw where the food had to be send back then it  had a weird taste and my bread turned black from something from the grill. I guess that type of service is why there wasn&#39;t a wait

Here&#39;s a blow by blow account:<br><br>Arrived at opening time and were told a 5 min wait even though there were only 2 couples ahead of us. <br><br>Finally seated. Had to ask for water twice. Took order after 20mins. Waiter came back 10mins later and said they can only do poached eggs on a Sunday. <br> <br>Coffee has been empty for 20mins. Took 15mins to clear empty side plates. <br><br>Food finally came 15mins later. Wasn&#39;t bad but my wife&#39;s toast was burnt and there were onions in the potatoes which isn&#39;t on the menu. That&#39;s a problem for me as I have a physical intolerance to them.<br><br>This is our second time at a Cheesecake Factory this week and both experiences have been the same. Very poor, impersonal service and you have to ask for EVERYTHING throughout the meal. There is absolutely no proactive service like you would get elsewhere. We won&#39;t be back at any of their restaurants.

The wait wasn&#39;t long despite of it being packed. Once seated I noticed our utensils were dirty and there was food under the table. We requested  new utensils and to have someone sweep under the table. Once we got our food,  my shrimp was burned and the pasta was cold! I did  have my food  replaced, but it wasn&#39;t any better. The service was ok despite of the waitress that didn&#39;t do much to accommodate us. Oh, can&#39;t forget the prices- this place is overpriced! Terrible.. Needless to say we won&#39;t be retuning. Time to replace it with something better! I left Hungry, I&#39;m disgusted! I wish I can get my money back. After all , I left the whole meal.
Why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake? You know I love to go there. Say I&#39;m actin&#39; lightskin, I can&#39;t take you nowhere. This a place for families that drive Camrys and go to Disney.

The worst customer service I have ever experienced. I placed an order for pick up. Called to see the status of my order and was left on hold for for over 27 minutes. We waited 30 minutes to pick up the food, attempted to speak to the manager they had us on hold once again. Only to finally get our food with no apology. I was extremely disappointed.
Do not order take out they make you wait about 30 mins and the service is awful it&#39;s just a shame

This review is for the Dadeland Mall Florida location. Service was extremely slow as if they did not want to do their jobs. The tables were sticky and the floors were disgusting. The bathrooms were awful (needed cleaning). Food was typical mediocre CF fare, so the lack of quality food coupled + lack of cleanliness &amp; quality service = disappointing. Other CF&#39;s are much much better, but I cannot recommend this location.
I went to go eat there for my birthday good food the prices are reasonable and it&#39;s very nice and fancy &amp; the staff is wonderful :)

I come every month because its a lot of food and I can share and try different things. BEST black bread of life, I need order double ! My favorite plate is the meatloaf, yum! Always take cheesecake to go! Its a must!
I have been coming to this cheesecake factory since it opened and today the chilaquiles were awesome. I recommend there brunch on Sunday&#39;s it is great!!!

Dadeland Mall Every time I have gone to this location there is an issue the first time it was cold food the second time my mom had broken glass in her drink today I had hair in my food and I was offered a replacement who the hell wants to eat after they almost ate someone else&#39;s hair. Danny was the manager

I came to this location with my wife because we had a 25 dollar gift card and we have generally had good experiences with each visit. The food and service has always been good. The location at Dadeland was a horrible experience and my wife and I don&#39;t care to ever go back to a Cheesecake Factory. It took about 20 minutes for the waiter to even notice that we were sat down, after which we were already frustrated seeing people being sat and immediately helped. Then the manager asked us if we would move because he needed the table for a larger group. Once the food arrived (hibachi steak), which took a while, the meat was burned on the outside and the vegetables were still raw. I&#39;ve had the dish before and it was nothing like how it was before. Overall it was a frustrating experience and mediocre food.

I have always enjoyed the food at the Cheesecake Factory - most recently the Greek salad has become a favorite with the Teriyaki Chicken and the Pepperoni Pizza. Of course I love the desserts! <br><br>I have eaten here several times when staying at the Marriott Miami Dadeland. It&#39;s an easy walk from the hotel. <br><br>The reason a 3.5 star establishment gets 1 star is the absurd corporate policy of sending out kids menu food on plates to hot to the touch. Why they cannot simply plate on regular plates is beyond me. Every time we are there with our kids, we have to send their orders back to be re-plated. As long as this continues to be corporate policy at the Cheesecake Factory, I will give everyone I eat at 1 star reviews despite the level of the service.

I had Sweet  Corn Tamales Cake for Appetizer  and they were  delicious.   Main  Course was Fettuccine Alfredo  with Chicken. The waitress  was overall  great.  I&#39;d enjoyed  dinner. Full, full!! Thanks  Cheese Cake  Factory.
Amazing food and fantastic service by Kevin. <br>Farfalle pasta cooked to perfection, and to finish our meal with the amazing Godiva cheesecake. <br>Thanks to Kevin for our quick and great service.

Meh. Had an overpriced cocktail that tasted watery. Stuffed mushroom appetizer was good but small. Steak Diane/shrimp scampi combo was not great. 3 overcooked shrimp in a watery cream sauce, mashed potatoes and a few small pieces of steak with mushrooms. Server was nice.

Ubered to the Cheesecake Factory in Dadeland Mall last night because of the recent closure of the Coconut Grove location.  The bright spot upon arrival was seeing Brent a bartender form the Grove  Cheese.  The place is massive compared to the Grove and lacked a certain vibe that the Grove Cheese imbided.  Brent more than made up for the lack of personality the  Dadeland location has compared to the Cocowalk Cheesecake.  He is professional, attentive, and a major reason we will &#34; Uber&#34; back there soon.  He is a definite positive addition to that location.

I do not recommend this place. Totally unsecured. I was stolen at parking. The window of my car broken, personal items stolen.  Nobody from the restaurant supported me.  The worst experience ever! I will never return to that place

Yum! I love coming here when I&#39;m with a few friends and none of us can decide what we&#39;re craving. So many options and everything is delicious! I&#39;ve never had an issue with the service here. Everyone is attentive and clear. <br><br>It can be crowded on weekends, so if you&#39;re with three people or less try aiming for the high tops or the bar.

This is the best Cheesecake Factory hands down! I recommend the Louisiana chicken pasta and the stuffed mushrooms. But, the best part is the red velvet cheesecake. Good service and big portions!  I recommend this location over any other locations that they have.
There was sticker on my banana which means they didn&#39;t rinse or inspected these bananas before cooking. And server was quite rude.

They were about to seat us at a messy booth but noticed it and moved us to another booth that was too messy. After a few mins we ended up going to the first booth we were originally going to be seated in. We waited a while for food, and they got one order wrong. Food tastes the same as other restaurants. Waiter didn&#39;t come very often making us wait more than usual. Overall nice atmosphere.

This location is a hit or miss. You can either have the best experience or the worst. <br><br>The waiters are very knowledgable and they can all speak greatly about the menu and will recommend you very good plates depending on your cravings. <br><br>One of the best things at cheesecake is the complimentary bread they bring you, but at this location, most of the time it comes stale or old. This is definitely someone they need to work and improve on. <br><br>I will say tho, they have one of the best caipirinha in town. Be sure to ask for extra lemon because it will heighten the taste and you won&#39;t feel the strong liquor as much. <br><br>It is after all cheesecake and the verity is excellent! Be sure to leave some room for any of the flavors, but I can never get anything else than the Oreo cheesecake! It is one of their best.

I just place an order to pick up and it&#39;s awful!!!! I came here before and it&#39;s fine but if you&#39;re going to place an order to p/u just don&#39;t do it!!!! I ordered steak Diane with mashed potato and guess what the steak is not what i expected and came without the mashed potato. What a night
This place used to be good but it&#39;s gone down the drain. Don&#39;t even attempt to place an order for pickup! The phone will ring and ring and ring

My appetizer came ice cold. Although I hated to send it back, I couldn&#39;t go any further. It came back with a HUGE hair right on top. Later I was in the ER with food poisoning. I didn&#39;t take it up with management, which I now regret and I hope my experience is an isolated one. Over the years I&#39;ve spent a lot of money in this store which makes it all the more depressing.
5 stars for Gina and her awesome service! 5 stars for the delish Tex-mex egg rolls and the creamy potato bacon soup! 10 stars for the Chocolate Tuxedo cheesecake!!

My family and I decided to come to Cheesecake Factory in Dadeland , cause it&#39;s always been very pleasant and enjoyable  decision , until today.  Sunday September the 13 th 2015<br>The service , horrible , we were starving and we wait for an hour, even with the restaurant almost empty , the food was  also a disappointment in all senses , it was cold and the presentation , nothing like <br>the way it used to be , the chilaquiles looked terrible , I work hard for my money, and I don&#39;t need to spend it in places like this , I won&#39;t come back.
Received horrible service and mediocre at best food. With all of the restaurant options available here, just go somewhere else.

Ive been to This place since the day it opened. They sat our party quick but it took 20 minutes just to get water  and an hour and a half to get our food last night. We ordered 3 Appetizers and <br> 2 soups and they came 3 minutes before the entrees. Tables around us were &#34;flipped&#34; twice with different guests with the same waiter. <br> They were nice to us and we didnt even request to speak with a manager. Oh and the beers took about 30 minutes. Very disappointed after being a loyal customer. Ultimately 3 hours being there was too much.

I love this place and never had an issue until my last visit. We sat for over 15 minutes waiting for someone to greet us and take our order. I had to track down our waiter who rarely came by the table. On a positive note-the food was amazing as always. The fried mac and cheese never lets you down. You must try the lasagna verde (portion is plenty for 2 people to share) I was quite surprised and my favorite new dish!

Our waitress Carla was very nice, food tasted good except my husbands side alfredo pasta, it was just boiled fetuccini no oil, butter,salt NOTHING! They brought two entrees first the next two 10 minutes later side pasta 15 minutes later so much for having dinner together. No, i don&#39;t think we are coming back to dadeland&#39;s cheescake factory any time soon.

I love The Cheesecake Factory. We are staying at the Marriott across the street from here so we decided to eat here. Service was great and the food was wonderful as always. Only thing I would say is that this place gets really packed so be prepared to wait a bit especially on the weekend. One downfall though was the size of the pieces of cheesecake. They have gotten really small for the price but I guess that the way it goes.

I don&#39;t come here too often. Today I decided. Shopping so I wanted to just relax and have a little lunch. I sat at the bar, Jerry was great. Very polite and attentive. I chose the chicken slider apps. Oh my god so delicious. Perfect for a chilly day. For an app was pretty generous with the portions. Came with 4 fried chicken slidders accompanied with fries, but that was extra. The sauce was divine. A kind of thousand island type but much better. I accompanied with a glass of Pinot Grigio. I&#39;m so excited to find out that they have happy hour M-F 4-6 and this app is on it for under $6. Very pleased with y experience today. And since it was during the week, no crowds!

So I was so excited about ordering the Bam Bam Chicken and Shrimp plate, sadly when I got it it tasted like a bad mix of sweet lemons and plain chicken. For a Wednesday night it was a bit packed but no excuse for the bad service, our waiter was taking his sweet time checking in on us. Finally when we got our food wear to steal silverware from the table next to use because our table had none and after asking 2 different waiters (15 minutes later). Not worth the $20 plate and doubt I will be coming back.

My favorite one is always Thai lettuce wrap.  There are more choices on healthy menu as well. It was raining that day, we sat at the patio so they closed the automatic windows. Service is always good.

I&#39;ve been coming to this Cheesecake Factory since it has opened and though it has changed their menu a bit, they still deliver great food and service. The reason why I only gave it 4-stars is because our server was a little pushy on getting our order in but with so many options, it&#39;s hard to just choose something!! <br><br>On the other hand, there is always a wait to come here...it doesn&#39;t fail. So I understand if he was trying to get us out in order to accommodate those that are wait but still... The calamari was delicious and plentiful! We had the Jambalaya Pasta and though spicy for the common man, it was so good and addicting as someone that likes spicy food! No cheesecake this time around but my boyfriend and I plan on going back just for that!

This is a great cheese cake location. For a Saturday night the wait was only 2 minutes. I was totally expecting more. We literally walked in gave our names turn to see cheese cakes and bam we were being seated. Our server was attentive, straight to point and gave us space. Points to him. I believe his name was Curtis, nice guy. He didn&#39;t linger and was there when we needed him. The food came out fast and was totally delish, the drinks were great but a little light. I will definitely come back. Everything was grade A, I especially loved when only one of appetizers came out and the manager came to apologize and give explanation. I haven&#39;t even though about the other appetizer. We were sharing everything anyways that I just wanted to eat period it didn&#39;t matter to me when anything was coming out as long as something did :) but it was such a nice surprise.

What can i say. This is one of the rare  chain restaurants that i like! Its located in Dadeland mall. Parking is everywhere if you are one of the Lucky&#39;s ones who find it. Just come before 12 if you can for lunch and theirs plenty of parking.The restaurant is large plenty of seating and bar area is a nice size. When I Go I normally sit at the bar and catch up on sports on their TVs. People dont like to eat their food at the bar but i do.Great service and food comes out quicker I have noticed. The restaurant and bathrooms are kept clean.The staff and bartenders are great. My favs to get are the stuffed mushrooms on their small plate menu and their Crusted Chicken Romano with Spaghetti. Sooo Good. Then comes dessert. Its the hardest thing to chose on their menu in my opinion. I go for their Dulce de Leche Cheesecake. Mmmmmmmmmmmm just getting hungry writing this review. Lol Enjoy People!

I really thought this location was losing its great service and good food. I had not come in a long time and went last night for dinner. The beauty of an early dinner at 6:30 pm? only a 5 min wait! This place can get really packed on weekend nights, the wait ranging between 45 minutes to 1 hour. Come early for lunch or an early dinner so you dont have to wait so long.. anyways, the service was great and the food was excellent, warm and fresh! Didnt get to have any cheesecake though :( i got way too full from the bread!<br><br>Best appetizers:<br>-fire cracker salmon rolls<br>- crabcakes<br><br>-Entrees: Always big enough to split!<br>Chicken Madeira: the best!<br><br>Pasta:<br>Crusted chicken romano is also great and the louisiana chicken pasta.

The good was absolutely delicious. Our waitress was extremely sweet, smile on her face the whole time and super attentive. I wish I remembered her name. Entrees were the four cheese pasta with chicken, really yummy. Hubby had the salmon with mash potatoes and asparagus. He usually has salmon when we got to a restaurant and he said this salmon had been the best he ever had. The dessert was also delicious I asked the waitress to recommend which one of the chocolate selections was the best and she recommended the Hersheys one it really was wonderful we also tried the Natala one which was also very good. We haven&#39;t been to the cheesecake factory in a long time and it was our first time visiting the dolphin mall location we will definitely go back again and we hope to get the same waitress we had this time she was excellent

I love this place when it comes to cheesecake but the food is not so great . The service is good during weekdays but for some reason not so great on the weekends , maybe because they are busier on the weekends

Arrived at 11:30 on a beautiful Saturday in Miami.  Asked to sit outside and was there was only one server and it was a 15 minutes wait.  Literally 15 empty tables outside.  I asked if they could seat us or get an additional server for outside and was told they all come in later.  I left and will never eat another Cheesecake Factory in my life.  Such a simple thing ruined the vibe on a nice Saturday.
Good food in general especially shepherds pie. But SERVICE EXTREMELY SLOW. Even bringing the check and returning was slow. They need to improve.

No idea what&#39;s going on at this location. Went last week with my mom for early dinner date and was really looking forward to it. We were greeted as always happy and was seated quickly. Ordered the avocado egg rolls and were not as good as I remember. Ordered the jambalaya which is my fave and go to plate from them and boy was I surprised at the plate and presentation put in front of me after waiting 30+mins of delay. The noodles were dry and the sauce was just put on top very lightly. The waitress came by I let her know what&#39;s going on and she agreed it didn&#39;t look as it should. She came back to inform me the kitchen manager was going to remake it again. It came out again another 20 mins later and this time it looked like it was a plate of noodle soup DISGUSTING. I returned it because it looked horrible, the manager came out and literally looked either high or half asleep. He just said sorry and left. Needless to say very disappointed with our mother daughter date. I was with some girlfriends last night and they all complained of same location and how the food has taken a toll for the worse. Too bad!!

Let me start by saying that I&#39;ve never really been a fan of this place: gargantuan off-putting serving sizes, mostly subpar food (except for the Cheesecake, of course) and bizarre Egyptian Art Deco-y unidentifiable themed decor. But, the last time I went there really took the cake (or should I say, &#34;cheesecake&#34; buh dum tiss) for terrible experiences. <br><br>I ordered the Evely&#39;s Favorite Pasta, which tasted kind of sour and wasn&#39;t very good but I was starving, so didn&#39;t complain. <br><br>Two of my friends had the Fettucini Alfredo... big mistake.<br><br>We leave, and go along our merry way to hang out at a lounge. About an hour into our fun girl&#39;s night out, my friend runs to the bathroom and gets sick. Mind you, we didn&#39;t drink and we hadn&#39;t eaten for hours before going to cheesecake. <br><br>About two hours after that, we decide to head back to my place and head our separate ways. My other friend who had the Alfredo, says she feels fine, says good bye and gets into her car. As soon as she turns on the car, she swings open the car door and yacks violently all over my driveway. Coincidence? I think not! <br><br>The next day, we call to complain. Well, that didn&#39;t work out initially. The manager who I spoke with was extremely dismissive. He had the audacity to tell me, &#34;Well, we make all of our sauces for each plate from scratch, it&#39;s not like they&#39;re sitting there in one batch.&#34; Really? Really guy? You&#39;re going to tell me that you people make sauces from SCRATCH for each individual order you get on a very busy Friday night and yet manage to take only 10 minutes to get it to your customer? You must think I had a botched lobotomy, or something. Even if you did in fact, make each sauce individually, it doesn&#39;t negate from the fact that the ingredients may not have been fresh. I highly doubt it was pure coincidence that both of my friends got sick from the same exact dish when they hadn&#39;t eaten anything but that in several hours. <br><br>Luckily, we called later that day and the second manager was extremely professional and apologetic. He gave us the information to report the incident to corporate. <br><br>Moral of the story: Stay away the Fettucini Alfredo!

Exceptional service by Alejandro! Our server was very well versed on the menu and he explained all the specials. He works like a server should: quick, knowledgable, and kind. Food took a bit long, but he made sure we were good with constant refills and bread. We ordered the orange chicken, pretzel chicken, fried veggie fries (eggplant, avocado, and zucchini), and a sausage and ricotta flatbread. The flatbread could have been a bit crispier, but overall a great meal. We&#39;ll be back, hopefully with the same server!!!

THIS DESERVES LOWER THAN ONE STAR BUT UNFORTUNATELY THAT ISN&#39;T AN OPTION! The service is horrible! The food is mediocre! The waiter was missing half of our food and it took two hours to receive our food!! Not only that but it took so long for our food to come that we barely had time to eat because the valet was already closing!! I will never be eating at this location again! How disappointing!!!! They hadn&#39;t even started on the fish tacos so we canceled or order. And my husband had to eat off of my plate !!!

I ordered the ALMOND-CRUSTED SALMON SALAD. Here is how its described on the menu:<br>Pan Seared and Served Over Kale, Shaved Brussels Sprouts, Arugula, Avocado,<br>Quinoa, Cranberries and Radishes. Tossed with Our Vinaigrette.<br><br>Here is what I got- it was more like salmon lightly sprinkled in almonds with a bed of kale. I couldn&#39;t even find the brussels sprouts and there was absolutely no arugula. The avocado equated to about 5 bites, there were 4 slices of radish, about 5 cranberries, and a spoonful of quinoa. Considering the description, I expected more than kale and salmon with a few garnishes. I would have complained had I been in the restaurant, but I ordered it to be delivered though another vendor.

Aside from this location, I&#39;ve also attended the Dolphin Mall and Coral Gables Cheesecake Factory. I assumed this restaurant was going to be exquisite because of all the competing food spots around. I ordered a chicken alfredo pasta which only came with six small squares of chicken. I also ordered a frozen strawberry daiquiri which had a small shot in it, you can HARDLY taste the alcohol; only all the way at the bottom of the drink. Definitely won&#39;t be coming back

I was recently told that this particular restaurant has gone down the hill. It&#39;s been one of my favorites in this area. Definitely not coming back. The service was awful, my husband&#39;s meal, an omelette, was cold and I had already eaten my small meals when his arrived. Nothing on my beets salad was fresh and the portion was super small.  Waitresses did not even apologize for the delay in the food. What a shame...

Use to come here often the food was amazing, well seasoned Now for some reason it has gone horribly downhill ... did they stop putting salt ? Garlic ? Wow worse meal ever... did they change the chef ??? <br>I seriously dont get it...<br>YUCK didn&#39;t even take a doggie bag for the rest of the food...

Do you like cold calamari and charred pasta? Also, a restaurant that can&#39;t make a simple $14 chicken sandwich.  Then Cheesecake Factory Dadeland is the place to be. Order PastaDaVinci. First one came out salty, second one burnt, then a simple chicken sandwich had no chicken.  I give it 1 star because you can&#39;t screw up bread and they managed to serve cold water.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!! <br>I was here yesterday for a goodbye dinner for one of my friends. I get there at 5 pm, request a table for 8. I know I realize that&#39;s a big party, so I tell the hostess that we don&#39;t mind waiting for our table, so she says wait about 30-45 min. If anything make sure to check back in in 30 min. So we wait 30 min and go back. I check in to see where we&#39;re at in the waiting and the hostess said that they gave our table away?!? So I&#39;m already a bit upset at this point so I tell the hostess that that&#39;s unfair since they hadn&#39;t even buzzed me to go back!? She apologizes and says 20 min more max we&#39;d have to wait. So she then gives me a new buzzer because the first one didn&#39;t even buzz!! <br>So we sit in the restaurant this time and wait about 10 min. We get seated by a waiter called Sebastian, says a few things for organization since we&#39;re a big party. Just as I thought things couldn&#39;t get worse, throughout the course of the rest of the night the waiter takes 20-40 min in between to give us our bread, drinks, take our orders, give us our food, collect our plates, take our orders for dessert, collect our plates, give us our bills.. He didn&#39;t even come back to the table to apologize for the wait, or check to see if we were doing okay, if the food was okay?? My plate of food wasn&#39;t even filled up all the way!! If I&#39;m paying for $20 worth of food, I&#39;d expect it to at least be filled up nicely not just spread out to make it seem like it&#39;s served right. WE WERE THERE FOR ALMOST 4 HOURS!!!! We got there at 5 and left at almost 9!!! The most terrible customer service I&#39;ve experienced at a &#34;so-called nice restaurant&#34;.

I love coming to cheesecake because it&#39;s consistently good and there&#39;s something for everyone. No matter how many times I go there I can always have a different dish and never get bored. They also have a full bar which is great especially for Sunday brunch (mimosas). <br><br>This is one of those places that you just don&#39;t get tired of going to. Prices are reasonable $15- $20 per plate.
I recomend this place for every once in a while. Good quality price nice atmosphere and a variety menu

As with any Cheesecake Factory, the food is quite tasty. They have an extensive menu that will satisy any appetite.  Their drinks are delicious. However the service at the particular location is hit or miss. Ive dealt with extremely rude servers. Luckily their parting words usually go to the tune of cheesecake,  so thats always nice.

Really can&#39;t go wrong coming here. Obviously it&#39;s nothing &#34;different&#34; but I do like to come to a place where it&#39;s familiar that I know it will be consistent. Prices are so reasonably, portions are larger than normal (some sharing portions) and ambiance is nice. The servers are very friendly. Will always keep coming back as long as it remains to consistent.

The Cheesecake Factory definitely has a menu that can practically satisfy anyone&#39;s cravings. The portions are rather large, of good quality, and almost never disappoint in taste. As far as customer service, each server I&#39;ve had tries their hardest for a positive experience. I appreciate their attentiveness and knowledge of the menu. That&#39;s rather very important to me when I am deciding what to have that meal since I&#39;m very indecisive. The price is reasonable for the quality, presentation, and overall taste.

I&#39;ve come to cheesecake factory for years and it has been a personal favorite for my family and I, but mostly just me.  Let&#39;s be honest, its actually for their complimentary bread, but i digress..<br><br>i love everything about cheesecake factory and their options. They are endless, ranging from apps to entrees, drinks or just desserts. Prices are so reasonable based on the amount of food you get. There is an option for everyone, which is why its a no brainer choice for dinner.<br><br>Apps to try : Lettuce wraps, spinach &amp; artichoke dip, avocado egg rolls. The Louisiana chicken pasta is what has brought me back for years....

The food at this location was all right. I ordered the chicken Madera and I was completely unimpressed I&#39;m not sure if you guys change the recipe for the sauce but it was definitely not what I expected. I ordered a bloody Mary from the bar extra spicy and was given a regular bloody Mary I ordered a second one extra spicy and was given a regular Bloody Mary. All and all drinks were ok food was ok. I would say a good spot to go after church on Sunday.

Always a pleasure to dine here. A;ways good service the food is great. Crispy chicken costaletta is a family favorite, we always share it because its so massive. As for the cheesecakes, mmmm worth every penny. Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple is the best in existence.

I ordered their Shrimp scampi. The very small portion of shrimp for the price was ridiculous and had ABSOLUTELY no flavor. No amount of salt could have saved it. It was almost as if the dish had been made without any butter whatsoever. I wasn&#39;t sure that was even possible for Shrimp Scampi, but somehow Cheesecake made it possible.<br><br>The service was adequate with attentive servers and hosts but the quality of the food has significantly decreased over the last few years. This used to be my favorite place to eat in Dadeland Mall, after the unacceptable service my party received the Sawgrass location, but the franchise has become a non-option for dining in South Florida all together.
The service is great, the bread is to die for,and the food taste good as well. Just know after you have that great experience you will probably end up with food poisoning.

Drinks were so so,  I ordered a classic margarita and it tasted like juice. But our waitress Jessica  (who is <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbomb.com&amp;s=bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bomb.com</a>) suggested a Mai Tai  and I still wasn&#39;t please but made the best of it. Now my appetizer  the crab dip was delicious. I ordered the Jamaican pepper shrimp and it came out cold, so I returned it. I then ordered the NY strip and that was delicious. Overall the food was ok. We stayed mainly because of our waitress Jessica. She was a blessing. I I&#39;d like to mention the manager Steve who also helped out.

Let me start off with the fact that I actually like Cheesecake Factory, but the one in Dadeland Mall is really skeevy.<br><br>I went for brunch. The table they sat us in was dirty (syrup on the chairs and table top).  I ordered a plain Belgian waffle and 2 plain scrambled eggs. The waffle tasted like cardboard and the eggs had ingredients from someone else&#39;s eggs. What is SO hard about PLAIN eggs? Needless to say, I left hungry and disappointed. I will definitely never eat there again.

Decided to drop by for a quick lunch..kale salad-overdressed...grilled chicken-bland and dry...table and utensils and chairs and floors-dirty....service - limited. Clean up everything! <br>Note: With the addition of new restaurants in Dadeland, you really need to step up your game. IJS

One of the worst seating processes I&#39;ve ever seen. Absolute chaos. Finally walked out.  They have no clue how to handle and organize themselves.  The transmitter they give you is a waste of time.  You turn it in and then they resort to yelling names over a huge crowd of noise no one can hear. No organized lines or waiting, people congregate around the reception area so you can&#39;t get to it because they wait for their name to be called after turning in the transmitter and everyone piles up to hear over the crowd congregating..catch 22.  The staff not well trained and some barely whisper when calling out. Bad system.  Doesn&#39;t matter if the food is good or not if you never get to sit, order and eat.  Brought issue to their attention 3 times.  Just got an attitude. I have $150 in gift cards a complete waste, I&#39;ll just give them away to someone.  This location is poorly managed. Go elsewhere unless you have a lot of free time to waste and extreme patience.
I wanted medium well cheeseburger. It took half an hour and came nearly uncooked. Than i complained they brought again. This time was cooked but fries was very bad. Horrible cheeevake factory.
Amazing food and service! Carla who handles the curb side take out is amazing! Always gets the order right

Had dinner here with my wife and kid.  Everything started off fine and service was great.  I&#39;ve eaten here million of time and always been great.  This time for some reason the food took forever (1 hour) sitting next to us was another couple who sat down 30 after us and got their found at about the same time.  Both waiter and manager came by to tell us our food was coming out and they had an issue with the angel hair pasta.  Ok, I continue to wait.  Then when the food came out it was not what I was expecting.  No where on the menu stated it had heavy cream, just says it has lemon sauce with capers.  This was like a thick fettuccine sauce.  I could not eat it with my cholesterol issue.  The manager stated that he would make me something else but that it would take some time.  It might take another hour so I didn&#39;t want to wait and ask for the check.  <br><br>I might not come back.  Since now they open so many other restaurant in dadeland (Earls, Aoki, etc)

Stopped by for lunch with my wife. Have dined here before and was looking forward to a great experience. I was wrong.<br><br>Service was disappointing. When the time came for lunch entree orders the server only asked me what I wanted after my wife had ordered and prompted him to ask (he has already begun to walk away). Only after it became clear I was upset (well after my wife&#39;s salad has been served) did he ask if everything was ok. <br><br>As for the food - the avocado egg rolls had an overpowering sundried tomato flavor; they were crisp, but with an off putting metallic aftertaste. Wife enjoyed them (she loves sundried tomato, so their heavy handed inclusion didn&#39;t faze her). The tuna carpaccio was pretty dreadful; wasabi aioli with little flavor (might as well have been mayo), and a sweetness to the dish that totally overpowered the tuna. <br><br>As I write this I&#39;m still hungry, and heading somewhere else for food. What could have been a wonderful lunch was very disappointing; so much so that I left my Blue Moon Ale untouched, paid the bill and left. <br><br>With all the options nearby I hope CF gets it right next time!

Not the healthiest restaurant to go to, with it&#39;s oversized plates of food and undeniably tempting cheesecakes, but delicious nonetheless. :D<br><br>Favorite dishes hands down:<br>Crispy spicy beef-Thin tender cuts of beef deep fried and tossed in a mild spicy savory sauce served with white rice. <br>Hibachi Steak-Good juicy piece of steak, mashed potatoes with a wasabi butter over top and tempura asparagus. <br>Bang Bang chicken and shrimp-Chicken and shrimp tossed in one of the most creamy and succelent sauces ever, served with white rice. It&#39;s got a hint of coconut-y sweetness. Yum<br>Vietnamese Tacos-Asian sauced pork with fresh cucumber salad in a bao. Delish<br>Ahi Tartare-Yes please!!!<br>Factory Samplers-4 plates full of different Cheesecake factory appetizers as a meal or shared with a big group of people. Unfortunately this item was taken off the menu! :(  $25.00 for a plethora of their appetizers in ONE! (Unfortunately they&#39;ve removed this wonderful variety of foods from the menu)<br><br>Cheesecake Favs:<br>Red Velvet<br>Cookie Dough
Slow and disorganized service. Great food from a great restaurant chain. The problem is this location.

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory many times but this was my first time at this location. My friend and I went for lunch. We were seated the the patio area. There seemed to be a shortage of servers, as our server was barely attentive. We ordered a salad to spilt and an appetizer. We asked for lemon for our water, bread for the table and plates so share our salad. The app and the salad come out pretty quick but we had to wait to eat since we didn&#39;t have plates. We had to ask the server a few times to give us plates. The bread and lemon wedges came way after the food. I love the food there but the service was not impressive.

I usually don&#39;t call people out for poor service and even worse customer service especially with what is going on in society now a days, people have bigger fish to fry! I am honestly blown away at the total lack of any customer service @cheesecakefactory today! I was in the biz for many years and understand that mistakes are made and people have bad days. I was on hold for 17 minutes to place a pick up order. I actually arrived at the restaurant while still on hold when the manager picked up and I was standing next to her. At this point the manager did not offer any type of apology. She took my order and arrived about 20 minutes later for takeout. No apologies from the manager or the staff. No sense of urgency or customer service. I did not expect a free meal but did expect some kind of customer service from not the only the manager but the staff. It&#39;s simply ridiculous where customer service is now a days. I still know people that work at this location and nothing against them, but it&#39;s extremely poor management period! #thecheesecakefactory #poorservice #nocaring #lackofcommunication #totaldisappointment

We always come to this location. This experience was terrible. We ordered the Mac and cheese balls and they were hard and tasted burnt. My husband ordered the chipotle chicken pasta. Well that tasted like sud basically flame. We advised the waiter he offered to get us a fresh plate. About 20 minutes later his plate comes again. Still tasting the same but this time the pasta was raw. My husband basically ate hard bread and iced t. The manager voided his meal she asked if there was anything she can do he asked for a cheesecake. I guess we shouldn&#39;t have assumed that we would be given a free dessert. So needless to say $51 later my husband is still hungry. Not even the bread was good.

Bar service sucks during the day! I ordered a Mojito and he didn&#39;t even muddle the mint! No lime! Didn&#39;t get the bread we were offered,appetizer was ran to the wrong table and didn&#39;t come back out until we said something about it! Mind you,we got half of it because the &#34;runner got bumped and knocked it on the floor&#34;!!! So we waited for the rest to come out! Drinking our water down drinks while the bartender just sits chatting it up with a girl at the bar! Hasn&#39;t even asked how our meal is!<br>We finally had enough and asked for the Manager. He came over and when I showed him my Mojito, he replied saying that they don&#39;t muddle lime and mint there! So maybe you should change the name from a Mojito to a drink with garnish! <br>He didn&#39;t comp, didnt apologize, nothing! <br>Never again..

I loved this place. I really, really did. I went there for lunch in honor of my graduation from high school. And it was worth the price that we paid for the whole meal. The wait time was only about 10 minutes long, and my family and I got seated right away. My family&#39;s appetizers included the brown bread with oats, an order of fried mozzarella triangles, and some buffalo chicken.<br><br>For my entree, I enjoyed the chicken Parmesan sandwich with no marinara sauce, a side order of sweet potato fries, and a small side order of broccoli. To drink, I simply had ice cold water. For dessert, I enjoyed a nice big slide of the &#34;Oreo Extreme&#34; cheesecake. The cheesecake was cold, cheesy, and even chunky with real Oreo cookie chunks inside, as well as an Oreo cookie crust at the bottom.<br><br>I loved this fine dinning lunch experience. The service was fast and efficient. Our sever was very nice to us. It wasn&#39;t that crowded at lunchtime and it was the best lunch I&#39;ve ever had in honor of a big accomplishment of my life...high school graduation. I hope to come back again soon. I would highly recommend this place to ANYONE who wants to enjoy lunch or dinner in style.
The food here is awesome! Anything you order will be great :) But the cheesecakes are even better.. Worth going just for dessert

I love cheesecake factory but they never get my order right when I place an order to pick up. The Food is great but double check your older before you leave the establishment!!!!! It&#39;s very annoying to get home all excited then to find out it&#39;s not what you ordered.... I still ate it because I was starving but I wasn&#39;t satisfied :/

The food is good but the service isn&#39;t. Why does everyone working here look so depressed? And why do they look pained when you ask for bread or water? Unfortunately it feels like this is a place on it&#39;s way down...

Ok, everyone knows the food here is fantastic, with huge portions and the most variety EVER on a menu.  This review is about the server that we got today.  We went in for the half price cheesecake deal they were having since we wanted to taste the s&#39;mores cheesecake.  We were seated right away and the waiter came over and immediately put bread on our table, which was hugely appreciated since we had two small children with us that we could entertain with the bread and butter:)  <br><br>He came back over to take our order and when we said we were just ordering cheesecake and lemonades for the kids he looked super annoyed and stalked away from our table.  A few minutes later he puts the two plates of cheesecake on our table and yanks the bread basket (still full of bread) and the butter plate off of the table and walks away.  <br><br>So, we eat away at our cheesecake while pining away for our bread and butter, that we were enjoying immensely by the way, and lo and behold, toddler number one spills water all over our booth and my daughter, her mother&#39;s lap.  My daughter jumps up to clean up the mess and catches a glimpse of the waiter standing a few feet away rolling his eyes in annoyance.  <br><br>When he sees that she saw him he breaks eye contact and runs to get some napkins to give us to clean up.  To his credit, he seemed embarrassed and did try to be more helpful the rest of the time.  <br><br>I&#39;m still a little bitter about the bread incident which is why I am writing this review.

The last few times I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve had the same problem.  The plates are very hot but the food on them not so much.  I had lukewarm food.  It&#39;s a pet peeve.  The taste is good but it just ruins it for me.

I really liked the place for the first time being there.I brought my mom there mothers day that just passed. She&#39;s been there before, though still enjoyed herself. She had the fish and chips. I had the club with fries.Everything was great. I had to take a strawberry cheesecake home.I will definitely be returning to try some more entries there.

Finally got a chance to eat here. I have no idea why its taken me so many years to go. <br><br>Good service. Had the avocado eggrolls to start. Very good. Ordered the Habachi steak. Good steak, not as rare as I would have liked but soft and full of flavor.<br><br>You cant go without trying a slice of cheesecake or at least thats what they tell me. I went with the pumpkin cheesecake (its that time of year, lol) Very good. Would I come here all the time? No, but its a solid place to eat.

Not a friendly environment at all and the staff has no hussle. Waited for a table for 1 for 10 minutes, meanwhile 3/4 of the restaurant was completely empty. Unfortunatley, there aren&#39;t many choices in this mall, so if you can head to Nordstrom cafe.
Love the staff!!! Very friendly ! The menu is WAAAAY too much !!! Literally more than 100 different plates ! The food is good but not out of this world ! All of their cheesecakes Are amazing !
Can always rely on this place for take out, lunch or dinner while shopping, place to go eat dinner with friends or family. And of course, the cheesecake.
Amazing Hibachi steak better than most Japanese steak houses out there and if possible their chocolate tower cake is even better than heir cheesecake...a chocolate cloud on a plate.

I had dinner here a few times. 2 out of those times we were served by Anthony Lafontaine. This waiter is what has made our experience here significant. He goes beyond and above to make us feel special. He made great recommendations. The water never reaches the bottom of the cup nor does the lemonade. My wife is very particular in how she wants a certain dish (angel hair pasta w/ shrimp) and anthony makes her feel like its no issue at all.

Service: 5/5<br>Our waiter came by our table every 10 minutes and always had a nice smile on her face. Check came quickly and the waiter actually said she was pleased to serve us. <br><br>Decor: 5/5<br>The restaurant is big, clean, will lit, and in a great location. The Renaissance theme goes well with the food.<br><br>Food: 4/5<br>All of the plates we ordered were very good (fried cheese, 4 cheese pasta, pizzas, salmon pasta, and cheesecakes). The variety is also excellent, pizzas, pastas, appetizers, meats, fish, vegan...<br><br>Value: 4/5<br>Expect about $30-$40 per person. It is well worth it given the quality, variety of the food and being right in Dadeland.

Usually one of my favorite places to eat, this was one of the worst dining experiences ever!<br>The food wss bland but that was the best part of the visit. <br>The noise was terrible and the majority of it was coming from the wait staff and kitchen. They were yelling and goofing off. Our waiter screwed up our check so we tried to find him.  After about 15 minutes we flagged down another server. She took off looking for our waiter. Another 10 minutes probably went by before I had to get up and go find her. She was all flustered saying that she couldn&#39;t find a manager and that our waiter had an emergency. Finally, a young manthey said was the manager came up to the table and we explained the situation for the fifth time. He was very unprofessional.  He was wearing a necktie around his neck but not around the colored shirt. The collared shirt had two or three buttons undone. Anyway, he finally fixed the check for us and explained that our waiter had been in a fist fight with another employee over a female staff member. All in all we probably spent an additional hour waiting for them to fix their error. It was astounding to me that the manager would let the employees behave in this manner. The kitchen crew was unbearable. They were singing and dancing and yelling and the manager was standing right there. He had no control over his employees at all. I will never go back to this Cheesecake Factory!

Never a bad meal at The Cheesecake Factory.  Prices are cheap at this location coming from the NorthEast.  Filet Mignon, mashed potatoes, and green beans for a meal and tuna tartar for an app.  All that for $39 plus tip.  Everything was cooked perfectly and the service is fantastic.  It&#39;s always busy though.

What a great place for lunch! It&#39;s very peaceful and disconnects you from the surroundings. The restaurant itself has a nice enough feel to it for dinner (it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory after all), but Dadeland Mall does not really do it for me. It probably also gets noisy at peak hours. Parking can be a bit tricky, but the location is anyway convenient when you&#39;re zapping up or down Palmetto.<br><br>The service was very friendly, and I enjoyed my visit a lot. I only had the lunch size pizza. For dinner, you just can&#39;t leave without having some cheesecake. Next time!
I love there desserts and one of my fav is there mac and cheese stuffed balls everytime I go I order them!!!

I really like there menu.  The waiting Is terrible at any time any day.  Service is awful. . Don&#39;t bother in complaining,  sit and wait.  Management is never around and waisted time. This cheesecake is the only one down south , that&#39;s why we have  no choice. It&#39;s a shame that the management don&#39;t care about customer service.

Food is delicious but this time the service was just terrible. We sat down at a table and the waitress brought us water and bread. She comes back we order and we tell her to please bring my daughters food out first. So she can start eating right away. Then a couple sits next to us on the next table down. They order and get there food before my daughters food ever even comes out. By the time the food came out I was already full from the bread and water settling in my stomach. Need less to say I had to ask for the rest of the food to go. I ask for a to go box and they check and she brings the box and forgets the check. Then I had to wait another 5 mins. for the check. I know cheese cake factory is normally a great experience but this one waitress was apparently lost. Normally I have a 5 star experience here.

Was on hold for 20 minutes to give an order to pick up. First person I spoke with could not write down what I ordered. Put me on hold and never came back. I called back again and finally got someone who took my order. Hopefully it will b correct.<br>  We arrived at the pick up parking spot in Dadeland. And no one answered the phone at Cheesecake Factory. We called back 3 times and finally someone answered and couldn&#39;t tell us if our food was ready and coming out. It was very busy at Dadeland so we canceled the order and left, never getting our food.
This is a really good restaurant, great service and good food. Nice atmosphere and décor.

The Sunday Brunch is the really the best thing they do.<br><br>Their french toast (really french toast on crack) is the best I&#39;ve ever had.<br>Plain, or with the strawberries and pecans and Chantilly Cream.<br>(It was even better when it was walnuts and bananas and warm apple pieces that they put on top)<br><br>I&#39;m actually not a huge fan of the cheesecake. Too thick for me. I like a lighter cheesecake.<br><br>The dinner menu is good, but the portions are ridiculous and I just don&#39;t see the point of that. Come with lots of people.

I discovered the Cheesecake Factory back in So Cal in Redondo Beach, almost 20 years ago - fast forward to South Florida 2008 and the trip down memory lane reveals an unfortunate downward slide- <br><br>They are still pretty good and the portions are still more than what we really need to eat in a couple of days - One full portion of any entree in CF will pack enough calories for 2 or 3 days according the recommended daily allowance from the FDA - Specifically, I think the place can use some brightening up it is a bit dark - the service tends to be decent, with the occasional disdainful waiter especially when they get busy but overall OK. <br><br>The Balance is positive but there can really be too much of a good thing. <br><br>Try their Pumpkin Cheesecakes in the fall - they are hands down the best.

I absolutely loved my lettuce wraps, as usual, although the vegetables in my friends Shephard pie was undercooked. Our server Jesus was awesome, and the ambiance in always warm and inviting here. I highly recommend the steak Diane or the shrimp scampi.

Have been going there for years; always have a great experience.  This time we ordered pick up and I just wanted to recognize KeKe from pastry/take out and her manager Jessica. KeKe really went above and beyond her customer service duties! She&#39;s the best!

Really?!? you hope I give you another chance. Your question is as out of touch as you are obviously as manager. My wife and I both work, we took the time to come in to your restaurant in order to celebrate our anniversary and it was a shit show. I will never come back and will tell as many people as I possibly can of how poor he service there is!

First and last time coming here.<br><br>I came out with the family for what I hoped to be a small, quiet, birthday dinner. We ended up being disappointed with just about every part of the meal. First of all, a 40 minute wait in heels with absolutely nowhere to sit was terrible. The entire waiting area was a circus. It looked like the entrance to some kind of overrated night club. The hostesses were attempting to yell names over the roar of the crowd. Apparently the pagers they give you are completely pointless because if you stray out of yelling range you&#39;ll never get sat. The experience didn&#39;t get too much better once we eventually were seated. It was still incredibly loud at our table even though we were sitting in a separate dining area from the main restaurant. Our waitress was barely ever around and every time she was at the table she seemed like she was in a rush to get away again. I ordered the baja chicken tacos. They were so soggy that they fell apart completely every time I took a bite. Thankfully the tortilla chips I had leftover from the spinach dip actually made the dish edible. Another person ordered garlic noodles with shrimp which was just overly greasy pasta with 4 overcooked shrimp. The other people at the table were happy with their salads. Dessert was the best part but they couldn&#39;t get that right either. We ordered 2 different cheesecakes which were delicious and an apple crisp that looked like ****. It was literally swimming in melted ice cream and had a huge exaggerated dollop of whipped cream in the middle. Not to mention &#34;Happy Birthday&#34;  written in chicken scratch on the plate. Horrible presentation. Once I got rid of 80% of the whipped cream and swam through the ice cream soup to get to the actual dessert, it was delicious. I&#39;m only giving it the 2nd star because the spinach dip and the cheesecake were good. Other than that this place was a complete disappointment.
Such a great place - wonderful customer service.  Our food was taking a while and Jose (the manager) came by our table and apologized.  Can&#39;t remember when a manager at a restaurant did that.

I have been going to this Cheesecake Factory for over 10 years now and the quality of both the food and service has gone down tremendously but today&#39;s service was absolutely awful. I decided to order curb side pickup so I called to place my order, they told me they would transfer me to curbside and kept me on hold for 10 minutes. I decided to tell my mom to call to see if they would answer and they immediately picked up and took her order still leaving me on hold. They said the food would be ready in 20 minutes and I got there 25 minutes after placing the order. I called to let them know that I was outside and the girl on the phone said she would let them know. I waited 15 minutes outside before I called again but no one picked up so I called again, still no answer. I then went inside to get the food and it was just sitting there on a shelf. I picked up my food and asked her if she could bring me whole wheat bread and they gave me white bread and of course my food was cold by the time I got it. The amount of miscommunication or lack of care going on in that restaurant makes me never want to come back here again.
